the beer smells pretty good , very hoppy like one would expect from this type of beer .  wtf did they do to this beer ? this is the first time i tried it since they put in the new brewhouse and i 'm not impressed . this used to be a wonderfully drinkable beer with orange and subtle spice flavors that made it quite refreshing . now its just overloaded with phenolics and all you can taste and smell is cloves . i ca n't get past the phenolic flavors enough to even finish a bottle . just horrible .

clear copper with orange accents , forming a large , pillowy peaking light beige head atop fine bubbles . moderately strong carbonation .  this beer was skunky ... skunky like a becks . and i couldnt find any other component of this beer redeeming enough to get over that skunkyness . my encounter with this beer started out ok ... it has a pale yellow appearance with a medium amount of head . taste exhibited becks ( or maybe even becks light ) levels of skunkitude , again with a bit of clove chasing after it to apologize . definitely not recommended .
very good appearance and smell overall .  but i felt the feel was a bit thin .

the smell has dark roasted coffee beans , figs , dates , madiera and some yeast .  not sure what they used for malt , but very sugary at first . the hops comes in and stays with you . almost like an ipa with the first snoot full of hops . i suppose they have to keep winning people over cause of the whole inbev deal . king of beers , so i am not surprised .

smell was very appetizing , a rich sour cherry with a bit of roasted malt . taste was not nearly as robust , pretty much just a strong stout , a nice bit of burnt malt and coffee , coupled with a nice tartness from the cherry , but not nearly as rich and complex as the aroma had me expecting . mouthfeel was very rich and creamy , medium body .  m-medium carbonation . medium body , slick .

anyways always seem to go with styles not fitting to the season and well we are in the mist of june and i 'm loving me some barley wines at the moment ! smell , well imagine a bowl of uncooked fruit cake batter . rum , raisins , dark fruits and figs , dates sweet molasses and soft belgium brown sugar . taste ; velvety fruit cake batter , more of the same from the nose . this beer is deliciously smooth and creamy . such a dessert evening sipper for sure . although they are great beers it just seems to me they dont fit in well with the style of barley wines . the hour passed and it might of been the alcohol but i could of had another 12 oz .  smooth mouthfeel with a moderate amount of carbonation and just a little watery in the finish .
burnt , dark orange in color , and hazy clarity poured this one . plenty of carbonation led to a creamy light tan head .  body is not as full as i would like , but this is one heck of a tasty beer .

s - mmm , what a good smelling beer . delicious smell , and a lot of it .  had this on tap when i was being introduced to the lager style of beer . it 's smell is very specific to the beer and is appealing if you are craving a medium-bodied lager . its has a malty intake and a bit of a spicy , hoppy after taste . it goes down smoothly but the taste tends to stick around and interfere with ordered food . it is very drinkable but as stated , but be careful when drinking this with food .

a - clear ruby amber color with a wonderfully thick head that is well retained in a lacing s - noble-type ( kent goldings ? ) hop aroma , mild but most prominent ; faint malt with a trace of yeasty esters t - very well balanced malt and hop flavor , some caramel noticed but not strong , not much of a finish to it except some hop bitterness as the very end m - light body , moderate carbonation d - this is a highly drinkable beer .  tastes like , yeah , tart blueberries ( probably artificial blueberries ) . just sweet & weird & sweet ... really tough to finish one . much like a cheap , too-tart wine cooler .

clear , amber-bronze hue , a little darker than a standard ipa , served with a cream-colored head , a half finger in size , great retention . looks great in my pint glass . once consumption began it laced my pint glass like wallpaper , impressive .  less fizzy than anticipated in the mouth .
pours with an excellent appearance , thick tan head with small dense bubbles and a clear hazelnut color .  mouthfeel/overall : the body is very light , and it has pretty high carbonation .

sweet and very appealing like a hopslam . t - taste is a bit different than the smell and reminds me of pliny the younger . very good . o - i think this is a very fine dipa .  m- very light beer , at 3 % alcohol , nice carbonation throughout and thin almost watery .

lovely aroma of figs , coffee , licorice , lavender , pinesap , chocolate & mint . the dark roasted malts smell so very fresh , almost as if they were right there damp in the palm of your hands .  little lacing . it has an oktoberfest feeling , but not full fledge on the taste . very drinkable . i think i will serve it at my halloween party because of the label and easy drinking style .

s : chocolate , peanut , fruit , raisin . rich , but it took me a while to pinpoint exactly what this reminded me of , then it hit me - hazelnut !  m/d : the mouthfeel was a tad low , as i assume to the three years in a swingtop , but by no means distracting .

very nice . t : initial attack is pleasant , pure coffee , but then it turns quite bitter , but not in a hoppy way , more of an unpleasant burnt coffee way .  light-medium bodied with crisp high carb .

an alcoholic praline . profound amber hues and sticky fingers of lace .  tastes like an aged beer , its very dry and cuvee-like . significant hops.its wierd but it does smell like a barleywine . a bit undewhelming mouthfeel.there was some problem with foam in the taps , and maybe if i had this in the wee hours . still good .
dark chocolate brown with a nice , thick , creamy , khaki head atop .  perfect carbonation and ridiculously easy to drink .

beautiful , clear dark copper color . excellent clarity here . a moderate cap of light whipped cream , tiny bubbles mostly , sits at the top . this is as pretty as an ipa can be .  the beer itself is pretty thick , and mixed with the lingering foamy head , it feels great in the mouth for savoring what taste there actually is .

| 8.0 % abv | 2011 brewer : shmaltz brewing company ( he'brew ) style : american strong ale glass : crystal mug appearance : dazzling orange-amber under light , with a foamy , frothy head .  the mouthfeel of this beer is great . they do an excellent job with the carbonation and creating the perfect body for a beer .

longneck into a cascazilla pint glass purchased at the brewery : ( a very cool glass with some red hops on it ) a - copper/red hue with about a 1/2 inch head that quickly died down to an outer ring and no lacing - maybe it was the glass ' fault s - straight up pine and citrus from the hops , also some malt sweetness in there t - a burst of hops to start with . taste like west coast hops , and not too bitter , probably lots of late mid/late hop additions and dry-hopping , as there is a great hop flavor and aroma to this beer without too much bitterness . good supporting role by the malt to keep the hops in check . awesome job combining the characteristics of a red ale and an ipa .  ( m ) - this is ridiculously smooth despite its hop dryness and woody bite . great carbonation level and balance .
'' pours almost black with a generous amber head and fruity , hop-spicy nose .  m : full body , and shockingly creamy . this brew is extremely smooth of the mouth .

appearance : cloudy golden yellow with an amazing , big , billowy head that last all the way through the beer , incredible lacing too which sticks all over the glass . the best looking tripel i 've ever seen .  very smooth and rich taste though and perfectly balanced . wonderfull to drink though think it should be drank as i do n't think that more age makes this one any better .
this looks absolutely beautiful .  m : one of the most silky smooth beers i have had in quite a while . i would love it on cask , although the low carbonation is nearly perfect .
pours a hazy golden amber with a medium creamy white head that retains well and laces the glass .  the mouthfeel is very smooth , with minimal aftertaste .

the beer pours a jet black liquid ; impenetrable by light . the head is a nice coffee color , about an inch right up to the edge of my pint glass . the head retention is excellent and the lacing on the side of the glass leads down to a creamy top of the beer even when almost gone .  mouthfeel is thick and creamy , very nice .

head stays for a good while s- smells identical to apple pie .  excellent medium mouthfeel , that is slick yet dry - i could drink many of these but i am confident that time will lend complexity -- - please !
pretty good lacing , and , overall , a stellar appearance . however , appearance is n't everything .  the mouthfeel is exceptional and that is all i am going to say about this .

pours dark black - thick brown foam , long retention and heavy lacing .  the mouthfeel is great , for the bittersweetness from the roasted malts provide the ideal amount of oomph to an otherwise creamy body .
exquisite in appearance !  m : super creamy as it should be .

brilliant light gold with a solid finger and a half of tight foam . excellent retention .  finshes warming , hoppy & bready , very balanced approach mf : chewy with low carbonation & great balance dangerously drinkable , this would put you on your butt after a couple of pints but a really nice dipa
copper pour , good lacing and head here .  mouthfeel was virtually perfect .
a : black color . one finger tan head with good retention and lacing .  i love the mouthfeel on this beer , probably my favorite part of it .
) pours a beautiful glowing , hazy , golden color . really gorgeous and appealing appearance .  mouthfeel is heavy bodied and velvety smooth .

towards the end of the night it settles down to a thin concentric ring but a nice swirl brings you back to viewing what i consider one of the most beautiful looking barleywines i 've ever seen .  its very smooth and velvety , very nice .

a-pours black , no light penetration , with a creamy , tight knight , one inch beige head that has good retention and leaves spotty lace as i drink . nice looking beer .  m - so so smooth , much more than expected , carbonation in perfect and maintains a light body . perfect .
'' in the glass , beer is a dark mahoghany color , very attractive .  the mouthfeel was buttery smooth as silk with full body and low carbonation .

pours a beautiful crimson/brown color with a fluffy two finger head - as i move the beer around the head remains as one and sticks together , unwilling to fade away .  thick lushious body and moderate carbonation .
nice retention and awesome patches of lacing .  m : medium body with a fantastic carbonation balance ! amazing here !

pours a pitch black color with a tan colored head that fades slowly , leaving a thin layer of foam and some heavy lacing .  mouthfeel is what always gets me on these beers , i love the chewy creamy coats your throat feeling here .
head is nice , foamy and dense white and great retention . looks like a great pale ale .  the mouthful is creamy with perfect carbonation .
nice looking lager .  smooth as hell , perfect weight and carbonation .

appearance : beautiful deep gold color , a lushous two-fingered layer of white foam , lots of rising bubbles , good head retention , flecks of lace aroma : dusty , cinnamony , malty , honey-like sweetness , floral hops , plummy fruitiness , perfumy ( sage and roses ?  mouthfeel - heavy body with mild carbonation . it 's perfect to me .

a : amazing , witth a light brown head that initially takes up the entire glass . if you get this on nitro watch as the head melts into one of the best beers you 've ever had .  a nice smoothness develops into a wonderful creaminess .
this beer is absolutely stunning in appearance .  very creamy feel with a smooth molasses aftertaste .
the imperial stout was very black in color with a dark brown head . very pretty .  mouthfeel is quite exceptional .

mayan-inspired schwarzbier ? attractive pour , tons of lace and strong retention . fluffy foam that rises above the rim of the glass with irregular crags and peaks .  mouthfeel is outstanding , slick and effervescent .
pours out a bronzed hazed cloudy yellow color with two fingers of fluffy creamy white head .  sweet malts are offset by crisp hops together producing a wonderful balance and mouthfeel . sooo smooth !
big crazy head thats nearly out of control .  mouthfeel : low carbonation leads to thirsty gulps .
eye : looks great , nice rich color-deep copper amber . also has a nice white fluffy head with good retention and lacing .  perfect mouthfeel .

a- looks awesome . pours a crytal clear light brassy orange , with a massive white oamy , fluffy head that slowly shrinks down leaving behind all kinds of webbing lace .  very nice full bodied mouthfeel . easily drinkable .

pours a 1+ finger tan head over a brilliant bright gold liquid .  pours a rich copper with a creamy one finger head that that settles nicely leaving some light lace , deep intese fruity aromas with some underlying but very noticeable pine.wow a big flavorful barleywine very pacific coast piney and resiny upfront with a big fruity alcolholic finish the alcohol really hits.just a sublime creamy mouthfeel and pretty slick going down the hatch and it warms the insides.wow truley and awesome big brew a night cap that cant be beat .
medium-light yellow with a nice ring of head that leaves pretty decent amount of lacing .  thick creamy mouthfeel and mild carbonation . smooth silky mouthfeel is lucious .

a : solid black body topped with three full fingers of rich , dense , medium-brown head that just barely poke above the rim of the glass ; incredibly persistent retention and a practically solid sheet of lacing .  mouthfeel is exceptional . it feels good in the mouth but leaves no lasting memories on the taste buds .

pours hazy gold with a massive , fluffy white head . very promising appearance , but way overcarbonated if you 're shooting for anything lambic-esque .  m : medium body with the perfect amount of smooth , yet lively , carbonation . truly excellent .
aroma is of hops , sugar and vanilla . this beer is mostly sweet and overly oaky with an almost cloying finish that has very little hop bitterness .  m - perfect carbonation .

this porter poured motor oil black , produced a thick tan head , excellent head retention , and excellent lacing .  where this brew really stands out is the creamy mouthfeel . that smoothness works to perfection with sweetness , but does n't work quite as well with bitterness .

absolutely gorgeous beer.a ruby-brown color with a very slight head that is quickly gone.very little carbonation.aroma of malt.some fruity , wine like aromas.malt dominates flavor.fairly obvious alchohol.not as sweet as other barleywines.tends to almost be a tad `` harsh '' between the alchohol and hop bitterness.full bodied mouthfeel that obviously speaks for the `` big '' beer that it is.overall a good beer but the harshness detracts slightly.definately a monster in itself.worth a try by all means.i havnt had this in 2 years but remember past samples along the same lines.will be laying a few bottles down this year .  m- great body , great carbonation . feels good .

pours a cloudy , very dark golden orange/chestnut mahogany brown color with dark golden orange hues when held to a light source and a two finger frothy , pillowy yellowish beige head . excellent retention , only slowly fading into a lasting cap . sporadic chunks of soapy lacing left behind .  mouthfeel : true german feeling on this beer . medium viscosity , rolls across the palate smoothly and is perfectly carbonated . great overall feel and authenticity .

based on notes poured into a thistle glass with an effervescent amber with 4 fingers of rocky eggshell colored head . great lacing & head retention s : ever-so slight sweet berry smell t : malty , fruittyness , a hint of warming boozeyness up front .  m - smooth and creamy ! d - surprisingly good for an american porter .

a- body is a moderately pale amber hue that pours with a nice 2-3 finger foamy white head . body is uniformly translucent and has the head has great retention with lots of lacing left all the way down the glass .  mouthfeel : oh wow , this is super-good . very , very creamy on the palate , with moderate ( but focused ) carbonation .
a- body is a nearly transparent dark copper hue that is served with the perfect 1/2 finger foamy white head . the head has perfect retention the whole way down the glass .  fantastic mouthfeel .
pours a very lovely rich golden color with a creamy white head that clings to the sides of the glass as you drink .  mouthfeel knocks this thing out of the park .

color is pure copper , exactly matching the unoxidized metal . beautiful . the head was outstanding , but i did make an over-aggressive pour . it faded to a normal cap , but didnt stick to the glass well .  tastes great with a full creamy feel as it slides down . bitterness follows in the wake , lightly lingering , lapping leisurely .

1-fingered extremely light tan head with very impressive retention , leaves rings of lace all the way down the glass .  mouthfeel is medium bodied with low to medium carbonation , fantastically smooth beer , very very nice .
it poured with a big , long lasting , and super stiff foamy cap .  really great mouthfeel of this one has won me over .

a : beautiful deep mahogany red with a sea of suspended particles almost resembling a galaxy . alright head retention with plenty of lacing .  mouthfeel is perfection . perfectly carbonated and very refreshing .

looks the part . `` glugged '' into my tulip glass and created a nice tight brown head that leaves lots of lace as i drink .  feels amazingly clean and fresh while keeping the flavor of charred wood and grains . smooth , creamy , full bodied , and almost a velvet nature . the carbonation is played on in the background as an overcoat . the simplicity of it overwhelms me .
i also love the brownish patina imparted to the deep red colour as it sits in a chalice .  perfectly carbonated , with a thick chewy body and a strong alcohol burn .
like nocturnum , my favorite of the delirium family , this beer has nice white fluffy head . the beer pours orange/gold , and the head lasted through the entire glass .  mouthfeel is fantastic .

appearance : clear gold with a mammoth head , slow fading , lightly hazed body . looks good .  m - this is by far the smoothest ipa i 've ever had . the pour from a hand pump straight from the cask creates the perfect texture for this beer .
a- pours a tar-like black with a tan head .  m - extremely smooth .

appearance this one is light yellow in color with some noticeable carbonation and a big , beautiful , head even though i had it in a taster . the head left some foamy pits and lacing all over the glass .  m : the mouthfeel is dense and creamy and frothy ... and almost stout-like . excellent .
this beer pours with the most beautiful colors of orangish-red . it recieved a perfect 5 .  mouthfeel - very smooth with a rich body and muted carbonation .

this beer looks fantastic . orange side of golden , clear with a big white , fluffy head .  mouthfeel is silky smooth , really nice . body fairly full and the beer leaves an impression all the way over the tongue .

outrageous head , again in the style of a belgian , super white and frothy with tons of bubbles . good retention and carbonation , stunning lacing .  mouthfeel : the mouthfeel is absolutely incredible for a milk stout .
sharp , slightly tannic porter that pours a deep dark ruby-brown with minimal head .  full bodied with creamy carbonation and a lingering sweet licorice finish .

on to the beer : little is wrong with the appearance . the head is thick and sports plenty of its original self , peach colored body has the `` glowing '' illusion at some spots . it 's just one bitter mess with some soap and soft waves of phenols ( more specifically , pllastic ) that do n't belong and the beer becomes even more unpleasant .  mouthfeel : perfect , just like champagne .

on tap stone brew co. escondido , ca a dark , hazy orange with golden yellow edges and a small white cap atop . messy , spiderweb lacing around the glass . a very beautiful glass of beer !  m : lovely . sort of creamy , without being too heavy .
multilayered rings everywhere - one of the best lace patterns i 've seen from a beer in a long while .  the mouth feel is the richest and thickest i have ever tasted in a beer !

i rarely describe a beer 's color as `` black '' , since most are actually a deep brown , but this poured like motor oil ! i got just over a finger of deep-tan head with decent retention off of my pour .  mouthfeel is the star here . it 's plush , velvety ... is nice .

pours a lovely shiny ruby colour , rich and clear . head is beige , nice and dense and retaining thin crown . lace is good and sticky . looks wonderful .  the taste starts with a slight carbonation . the carbonation builds to reveal a sweet velvet feel . a milk chocolate flavor with a roasted finisht showcases a great mouth on this beer .

pours a beautiful clear copper with a tight beige colored head of foam . the head sticks around , with good lacing on the glass .  mouthfeel ; very tight and lively carbonation , slick and creamy in the finish , pretty complex and admirable .

tasted june 22nd 2011 ( from notes ) poured into a la chouffe tulip a - a clear blood red , one finger tan head and some lacing s - alcohol , wine barrels , sweet dried fruits , earth , oak , french vanilla and more sweet and alcohol t - alcohol , lots of sugar , sweet malts , tons of sweet dried fruit , black cherries , wine barrels , raisins , charred oak , molasses , carmelised brown sugar and vanilla .  fairly crisp in the mouth , with an exceptional smoothness going down .

22 oz bomber poured into a pint glass a- hazy orange with a fluffy three finger head s- not as strong of a smell as i would like it to be , some malts and very little hop aroma for a 100 ibu double .  outstanding mouthfeel ! very drinkable .
the bottle popped furiously , and poured with a full head and glowing color .  mouthfeel : fantastic . great carbonation , no real aftertaste and washes easily over the palate .

this beer has perhaps the most beautiful color i have ever seen from a beer . my beer glass looked like a precious gem with this beer inside of it . it had a nice white head that seemed to have just a slight bit of pink .  mouthfeel is outstanding . super thick and syrupy , that flavor coats the palate forever .
a - dark , almost black with a beautiful one and a half finger head that is very creamy , love the cascade effect .  mouthfeel is creamy smooth , thick body , low carbonation .
poured into a tulip . billowing head , color to the amber side of golden and nicely hazed , outstanding lacing .  mouthfeel is thick and chewy , as it should be fir a beer of this strength .

bottle : poured a medium amber color ale with super big foamy head with great retention and good lacing .  the rich , smooth , roasted chocolate flavor works well with the silky body . this is definitely highly recommended , as the beers tend to be from great lakes brewing company .
a nice amber color with a thick tan head . lace was thick and copious .  m : really a standout porter . carbonation is perfectly dialed in and gives a very subtle tingle on the tongue .

appearance gorgeous , cloudy orange body full of sediment with a decent head .  it 's wonderful . alcohol tingles a little in the mouth and it 's certainly present in the aroma but buried 'neath the fruity yeast . expertly woven into the beery fabric of this brew .

a= at fridge temp , this ale poured a dark but clear mahogany brown color with a nice reddish glow . the first pour produced a light tan head that was only 1/4 '' but retained very well . retention was incredible and the stickage on my glass looked like emulsified foam ... beautiful .  mouthfeel- damn , this sh*t is creamy ! smooth , medium carbonation , but goes down super smooth . nice light bitterness in the aftertaste .

a : pours a bright yellow-orange , cloudy to the point of opaque but with some visible carbonation ; has the usual billowy , long-lasting head of dense white foam which settles to a healthy cap and leaves loads of frothy lacing .  m. just perfect for what it is . very smooth and thick .
poured a nice pumpkin orange with a big frothy white head that left spots of lacing here and there .  slick mouthfeel with perfect level of carbonation .

appearance the ale is a beautiful , almost perfect shiny copper in color with a wonderful golden head that showed good retention . it looks damn near perfect !  mouthfeel/overall : this beer is every bit of full bodied ; thick , chewy and creamy . everything an imperial stout should be . overall , a very good imperial stout that i 'd love to have full time access to .

s : very nice and inviting smell of lemon and malt .  not the stunner i was hoping for m- beautiful mouth feel . i sure hope this is not the `` great sculpin '' i 've been waiting for for that past few years .

the appearance is still wonderful , rich , creamy and delightful , although you get less of the wonderful spectacle of the bubbles gently settling on the surface .  mouthfeel : very thick and very very smooth , wonderful mouthfeel .

appearance is very much like celebration . orangish amber color with a very nice head - great retention , lots of lacing .  a faint bit of tannins in the middle of the tongue starts the finish , which is incredibly long with trailing , vineous notes of chocolate and spiced orange peel . ya it 's a bit like those warheads candies , but it 's tucked in such an incredible silky richness .
great looking beer .  it is exceptionally smooth and drinks perfectly for the style .

a- pours orange-amber with a massive , foamy and creamy head that retains amazingly , gives duvel a run for its money . the cloud is as big as the head of others .  mouth-feel was velvety smooth and creamy .

huge sticky head alone has a personality all its own . gorgeous golden haze pour that has no room for improvement , while in a class all its own .  mouthfeel : thick and chewy , yet not syrupy . carbonation is low and appropriate . in other words , spot on .
a : absolutely beautiful looking brew .  m : medium in body with a really smooth and creamy feel on the tongue .

a- beautiful red tint , lightly rising head . head fades relatively quickly leaving no lacing .  however , the mouthfeel of this beer is phenomenal , on the tim of your tongue it tingles , in the middle it is smooth as silk , on on the edges it is a touch syrupy ( amazing ) a good beer , but not worth the price they charge for it .

even with a careful poor i ended up with a huge , tan rocky head . this beer looks a whole lot better than it tastes with a bit cloudy , dark ruddy brown color , and that big aforementioned head .  still i thought the aroma was alittle weak , but once it hits your mouth it is amazing .

nice head retention , decent lacing . reminds me more of a weak amber than a euro dark lager .  super thick dark chocolate flavor , light coffee flavors , good coffee bitterness near the finish super creamy , heavier in body , extremely smooth and hopefully i 've mentioned the creaminess overall , i love this stout , give me more

appearance : shakespeare stout pours out nearly black with a full 3 fingers of mocha colored head . retention is very good , and lacing is very abundant .  the mouthfeel is super creamy and smooth . this beer coats the entire mouth in an almost velvety way .
the appearance is beautiful . a bit darker than i 'd expect a golden ale to be , but it looked great .  it is a full bodied beer with perfect carbonation .

a : two fingers of sea-foam-esque froth , barely off white in color , tops this brew but rushes to depart and leaves only traces of its existence . astonishingly clear .  typical stone excellent mouthfeel .
the color is a beautiful ruby red , almost purple in the light .  the mouth feel was excellent and one could tell the cask was being maintained properly .
amazing retention and lacing .  full bodied , super creamy and smooth . very nice .
this is more like it ... pitch black . pours a thick brown head that quickly swells to 2 inches and then recedes to 1/4 inch .  mouthfeel is fabulous with an amazing carbonation . it 's perfect .

hopefully since it appears to be bottle conditioned that the beer is still holding up a - poured into goblet an opaque black color . fluffy inch tall light brown head that disapates into a tinner covering that lasts until the end .  mouthfeel is quite amazing , therefore the 5 .

a : jet black with some garnet around the edges when held to ( candle ) light ; about the most enjoyable thing about guinness is watching the bubbles work their way up the glass , creating a nice and tight , light almond head , leaving nothing but an opaque blackness below ... s : hmmm , not much here ... maybe some roasted malts , but faint .  visibly effervescent , the mouth feel is perfect ... classic rich micro bubbles lend a smooth creamy texture .

when poured it produces a vast amount of off white head , which sticks around for a good while .  the hop particles make it sticky as hell , the rim of my glass is sticky , my lips are sticky , and the mouthfeel is outstanding ! as far as double ipas go ( which let 's face it this is really comparable to an ipa ) , i still prefer either pliny or any of the alpine ipas , but this is a nice change of pace .
pours a thick black with a large mocha head .  m- the first thing i notice with this is how smooth and creamy it is . d- a very enjoyable english barleywine . tasty .

appearance : the body is a cloudy gold color . the head is a slightly tan color , 3 fingers tall with great retention and lots of sticky lacing .  m : thick , full-bodied , and very creamy . low to moderate carbonation .

bottle in 16oz.sierra nevada glass leaves a beautiful 3/4 inch head . a-tremendous color , nice floaties , great lacing on the glass .  mouthfeel was full , thick , and creamy with a rich sweetness on the tongue .

guinness looks wonderful . poured into a glass , it 's pitch black but has dark ruby edges in the right light .  mouthfeel was phenomenal - silky smooth and with a slight hops bite on the tongue , giving 'way on the finish to a great caramel sweetness .

the color of this beer i find just amazing . it 's so dark as it sits in a guinness glass , with it 's beautiful smooth head . are there bubbles finer than these ? in contrast to how heavy it looks , it 's goes down incredibly smooth and fast .  this is a big , complex , full bodied beer . the huge amounts of malts in this thing are chewy and even feel like they stick to the teeth some .

good head retention that fades to nice lacing down to the last swallow . nice nutty brown color , with visible carbonation .  m - this is one of my favorite parts so far about this brew . moderate amounts of carbonation that whirls around your tounge and warms it in the process .

tasted in mid-may 2009. nearly opaque , black/brown , with reddish brown on the edges under the light . great lacing , forming curtains in the latter half of the glass .  the mouthfeel was silky smooth , and i think it was the best feeling oatmeal stout i have ever had . the low carbonation perfectly complemented the medium body , and the smoothness from the oatmeal made it a joy to drink .

a- beer pours a very rich , deep dark bown color with a nice mocha colored head . the head settles slowly , but not completely for a long while , and leaves some good lacing s- the nose on this is mainly of dark roasted malt , some coffe can be picked up as well but not very overwhelming at all .  mouthfeel is thick as hell and creamy , perfect for a big ris this is smooth as hell , much smoother than beers with this much ash flavor usually are .
a - beautiful hazy orange , loads of carbonation , four fingers of fluffy head with good retention . very little lacing .  smooth creamy mouthfeel that keeps you wanting another drink .
bottle poured into a dogfish head signature glass it pours clear copper color . a fluffy eggshell white head is very long lasting and intricate lacing across the glass .  f : wonderfully thick .
a-light brown with a fully frothy white head . plenty of retention and lace . an attractive beer .  super thick mouthfeel .

usual alesmith great appearance .  the best part of the rwanda gatsinga coffee stout is in my opinion the mouthfeel which is extremely smooth and leaves a pleasant malty coffee-dominated aftertaste and a smile on your face .

pours a deep , clear yellow gold with a little amber . massive 5+ fingers of thick and foamy head that just lasts forever . ca n't say enough about how great this looks .  huge bodied and full ( again , suggesting iipa classification ) . this is a beauty on cask .
this beer has an amazing champagne look . it has a crystal clear brass body with damn near perfect white head and lace .  however , it tastes great and feels great in the mouth .

appearance - cloudy orange , wonderfull perfect thick creamy head , good lacing . perfect !  the taste is initially of a very light porter and with a clean aftertaste that becomes a fruit sensation on the palate . the hop/malt balance is the real achievement here and it really contributes to the supreme drinkability . the smell upon opening the bottle is not an effective contrival of the taste that this beer is hiding as it only gives you an idea of the rooted flavor that is to be unleashed , the supreme balance and sublime flavor . great bier .
highly envigorated light brown head of fine bubbles that left behind a nice lacing on the pour .  the mouthfeel was amazing . nearly full-bodied .

very good aroma ! taste : smooth and malty but not too much . a bit of a let down after a very nice aroma .  awesome . drinkability : the mouthfeel is the star here , and not detecting most of the alcohol only helps .

huge amounts of fruitiness , candy , and grapefruit on the nose . sweet , light , and apricots also show up a bit . reminds me of some type of orange/apricot candy i 've had before but can not put my finger on it . very light , very fruity , yet tart but it is quite a curious taste . very easy to drink and although i do n't see myself buying a lot of lindeman 's myself i will highly recommend this to anyone trying a geuze !  great full and luxurious mouthfeel , witha soft , albeit intense carbonation that really lifts the brew .

the smell was so pungent i could smell it a foot and a half away , which was great . this beer was a great pleasure both to see and smell . taste : immediate bitterness that is the mainstay throughout the beer . perhaps , the appearance and smell had me too excited , but i was somehat dissappointed in the taste .  perfect example for a ris , and probably my favorite mouthfeel amongst them all .

the aroma is exceptional as you can smell this ale when you pour it out of the bottle . deep dark fruity ester mingle with a citrussy coriander spiciness make for an excellent aroma , this is the first beer i have tried in which the aroma exceeds the flavor . the rich aroma led me to a letdown as the flavor was much more subdued than i expected . the body of this ale is an immense letdown as a scotch wee heavy imo should have a bit more viscosity and sweetness but this is a rather thin ale in terms of body . the scotch ales always throw me off due to the lack of hops and for some reason i have a hard time enjoying tha malt flavors unless they are balanced by a signifigant amount of hops .  m/d : a full , silky smooth brew with low ( perfect ) carbonation .
pours a thick black color with a medium beige head .  in my mind , this is the perfect feel for an imperial stout .

s-this beer has one of the most pleasant aromas that i have smelt in a long time .  taste again where do i start ... sweet , spicy dark fruits soaked in alcohol ( raisins , currents , dates ) , toasted caramel notes , bready , some brandy / rum traces , biscuity , warming alcohol , spicy hop bitterness forces itself through the sweet maltiness , light madeira wine hints ... feel - so silky smooth ... rich and creamy ... light viscousness.. low drinkablilty for this one - a beer for savouring and sipping slowly ... overall - a phenomenal beer ... highly recommended .
pours a beautiful color , have to admit . deep gold/cherry in color -- like a cognac .  m- feel is exceptionally clean and smooth .
deep , dark , almost black in color , pours thick with a thin thick foam .  nice caramel aftertaste held on the tongue by the thick mouthfeel . creamy thick mouthfeel and modest carbonation .

overall really nice aroma . first sip is a mix of caramel and toasted malts with a touch of fruitiness .  m - absolutely creamy and delectable ! the amazing , tiny bubbled froth envelopes and contains any alcohol sharpness that would otherwise make this 8.0 % beer a bit fiery in the swallow . superb . d - the mouthfeel makes this otherwise straight-up scotch ale an incredibly drinkable beverage . but be careful ! at 8 % , this beer is like getting a two-for-one special in each pint !

bottle : poured a pitch-black color stout with a huge dark brown color ahead with good retention and great lacing .  considering the abv , the mouthfeel is perfect . d - at 12 % , you obviously ca n't have that many .

pours a very clear budweiser gold , with a fluffy white head . in a big glass mug it actually looks refreshing . the can looks pretty cool .  m : outstanding mouthfeel , is very smoothe and refreshing .

huge four fingers of bright white , soapy head .  mouthfeel is intensely smooth and velvety , creamy and luscious . lactic milk sugar contributes a boatload of palate-smudging heft . although it 's not one for sessioning , it has a sublime quality that makes you savor every sip .

head exhibits very impressive staying power , and impressive lace . color is a beautiful dark and cloudy orange , yellowing around the edges .  the texture is just flat-out perfect and this is about as easy to drink as you can want .

into a pint glass , poured a cloudy orange/amber with one finger of white , good retention , and great lacing .  the mouth feel is perfect - not watery , not syrupy , well carbonated , and very refreshing .
the sweet smelling belgian malts are very nice . the flavor starts out very well .  mouthfeel is full and round .

ever so slightly hazy orange color , with rocky head that lasts well and leaves good lacing .  the alcohol burns just a bit in the back of my throat , but overall the mouthfeel on this is amazing . d- wow !
this beer looks perfect . pretty gold color , with a nice big fluffy head .  the mouthfeel is right on and this one is immensely drinkable .

a : golden , almost apricot in appearance with about a 2 inch head and tons of carbonation . s : i detected victory 's hop profile a mile away ! yeasty , with citrus notes .  very light carbonation and a perfect body for a porter , combined with what i have already mentioned , makes this a very drinkable proposition .

poured into a duvel tulip , between the brilliant dark amber body and the tight , creamy head it fills the glass . simply beautiful - my wife heard me say something to that effect , took a look and said `` wow ! that 's pretty !  the mouthfeel was spot on and the taste was close behind .

stunning rich and assertive peach and banana nose . unfortunately , flavor , character and body do not follow . however , nothing in body , flavors or character could lead one to conclude that aging will help this dull , simple and short flavored beer with a fantastic nose . smell it ; do n't drink it .  m - big bodied , thick , and viscous as hell . middling carbonation fades to a really dry and herbal finish like green tea . wicks all moisture from my mouth !

16.9oz bottle - 2006 vintage - served at 45 degrees into a large snifter appearance : charcoal black and completely opaque . vigorous pour yieds a 3 inch head that is thick and creamy . caramel colored head with great retention .  m- full body in the mouth and sticky on the lips .

a : beautiful two inch creamy head . incredible creamy yellowy orange color with micro rising carbonation .  the mouth-feel was what was remarkable to me , very thick and creamy , i would liken it to a stout milkshake , really satisfying and enjoyable to drink .

and once i saw the pour of this beer i was highly anticipating excellence . it has an amazing color of a mackintosh red apple that glistens from fresh rain .  sweet flavor that i ca n't put my mind on ... m - excellent presentation , really enjoyable to the senses .

a : pale clear amber , it poured with a big cream head with lacing that slowly died .  a - opaque for sure ; not quite black , but very dark brown ; 1/2 '' tan/light brown , creamy head that diminishes to a thin layer pretty quickly ; lacing here and there , around the glass s - very nice aroma going on here ; notes of roasty malts , dark chocolate , hints of milky sweetness , and nice qualities of gingerbread too t - dark chocolate , vanilla , cinnamon , and ginger come first ; milky sweetness lasts from start to finish that is reminiscent of espresso ; slight bitter finish with roasted coffee beans and ginger as well m - medium to full bodied ; slight dry finish ; some carbonation that feels nice on the tongue ; can feel some warmth from the 9.2 % abv ; texture is very milky , creamy , velvety smooth o - i just ca n't get over how exceptionally smooth this beer really is .
the beer poured a nice black with a tan lacing .  the mouthfeel is luxurious , thick , and chewy . amazing . i am impressed with this brew . flavors are great and the mouthfeel is unearthly .
pours jet black with a thick , luscious brown head .  taste & mouthfeel : smoothness is impeccable within the moderate body , big doughy biscuity malt flavour is the showcase of this brew .

a : pours a cloudy , medium brown color with two fingers of billowy , pale tan head . exceptional retention and lace , vigorous carbonation .  m : very creamy feeling , small bubbles , not too sticky .

tons of mango on the nose . sweet and tart mango flesh with an herbal , citrusy hop note buried under the fruit . a great nose , i really like the fruit character . this was fairly enjoyable and very easy to drink , but i would n't go out of my way to try it again .  i keep tasting chocolate ice cream ... dry chocolate ice cream ... not cloy at all ... very fantastic finish and mouthfeel ... german beer ftw will buy again !

good god this beer is gon na be great ... frothy tan head that could get up and walk out of the room if it wanted to ... chunky . yummy looking .  mouthfeel : delightfully creamy and full-bodied . very pleasant .

bod : 11/17/10 pours a rusted mahoghany and settles jet metal black . a fingers worth of burnt caramel head sits for a short while .  appearance : amber , clear carbonated , medium head smell : alcohol , grapefruit , and citrus taste : alcohol , grapefruit , malts , hops , and slight caramel mouthfeel : smooth , slightly hard finish , can feel the carbonation ... it is amazing how smooth and unbitter this beer is for a beer with its abv drinkability : i will have this again , but may be one of the few that prefer the 60 minute ipa .
a- served in a tall pilsner glass . excellent clarity . looks beautiful .  the mouth feel is amazing on this beer .
the head is an extremely pale tan and stands at two inches tall . the head is frothy and light .  mouth is extremely crisp , clean with tremendous carbonation and a nice light body .

it 's bronze , perfectly bright . it 's foamy , with a good head and strong laces . this beer shows that a beer made to please the most people can still be made with great quality .  mouthfeel the best part of this beer , really smooth with just a little bit of carbonation .

the beer itself pulls a pitch black into the glass and lets no light through . darkness is right . head retention is decent , leaves a perfect lacing behind .  lush , creamy mouthfeel , that really could n't improve at all .

a gorgeous midnight pitch-black , with luscious creamy , light-tan head , almost a finger thick . impressive sticky lacing .  taste : excellent entry on the tongue & palate , beautiful , yeasty , rich and fruity . soft , yet earthy , hoppy , full-bodies , and delicious . an excellent tripel , for the sugary aspect was much more subdued than other offerings which misinterpreted , perhaps , the portions of the sweetness in the style . seemed nothing more , or less , than perfect , without being mindblowing .

pours a pitch black with dark brown edges . fine sticky mocha colored head about an inch thick with sticky , sticky lacing . i love stouts , and i love this one .  interesting effervescent mouthfeel makes it a pleasure to savor .

i absolutely loved this bottle .  a - bright golden orange color with some chill haze present , two fingers of white frothy head that leaves thick froth-lace s - not too much rye here , just hints ... hops and bready malt t - hop bitterness up front , sweet bready malts in the back , only a hint of rye in the middle ... the malt backing is about as significant as it gets ... taste 's more like a straight up ipa than most rye beers i 've had m - hops tingle the tongue and give way to very thick , chewy malts that slide down nicely ... full-bodied and very enjoyable d - this is a reeeally well-balanced beer , i just wanted more rye flavor .

750ml , 2009 ( ? ) vintage pours pitch black and completely opaque with a one finger frothy beige head that slowly fades into a lasting ring . sporadic rings and spots of lacing are left behind .  mouthfeel is very good , a light bodied beer with excellent carbonation ; it dances on the tongue and finishes smooth .

s- smell is awesome . tons of tropical fruits pineapple , apricot , and grapefruit a bit of sweetness coming through from the malts . t- follows the nose really well . a very nice hop forward beer .  great mouthfeel .

a - this beer has an incredible appearance , murky dark brown with an awesome lasting tan head that leaves some foam and great lacing .  mouthfeel- this is an exceptionally smooth saison , with the mouthfeel rivaling that of the saison dupont , my favorite of the style and one of my favorite beers . the tank 7 is definitely a thicker beer , very complimentary to the flavors .

poured a slightly cloudy , amber to copper color with . nice frothy two finger off white lasting head . ample lacing cling to the glass .  perfect . d : great taste , but a bit rich to drink in volume .
this smells promising . taste : toffee , brown sugar , caramel , dark fruits and sharp alcohol .  the mouthfeel is outstanding , like an expensive champagne and it finishes very dry .

attractive , crystal clear dark bronze hue . topped by a thick , fluffy head that recedes into a persistent one fingered layer .  mouthfeel- light palate with great carbonation that tickles the senses nicely .

what a great nose , to say there must be `` gagel '' in this beer ! strange but a good change of nose every now and then cant harm and this one is exceptional . too bad there is hardly any carbon dioxide and with it of course hardly any foam .  it has a wonderfully creamy mouthfeel that makes each sip a pleasure .

served in a pint glass poured from a 12oz bottle a : pours a deep black color with thick foamy head reminiscent of chocolate milk .  mouthfeel . amazing , thick rich and seems sweet but comes together .
very big head on this one . very big and fluffy ... looks like powdery hills of golden snow .  very nice finish ... it is incredibly smooth for an imperial beer .
the beer itself is not opaque and almost black . very nice looking in the glass .  wonderful carbonation .

ahh , maudite . a beautiful beer from a beautiful brewery . pours a dark , stained oak or cherry colour . nice , 2 1/2 finger froth head that clings to the glass .  great creamy thick mouthfeel , light carbonation .

this is a stunning looking ale : dark-brown with a ruby glaze , bubbles dancing toward the top like a light snowfall in reverse , crowned with a creamy mocha head .  body is velvety , full , round , and waiting to be enjoyed like a dangerous fruit i have in mind heh heh . finish is a fascinating contrast between exquisite and coarse , not too long and proly not a session unless ur into gettin hauled off .
the aroma is the best part , but it goes down smooth and tastes nice .  the silky smooth mouthfeel was fantastic and carbonation was spot on .

whoa ... a : freakin ' black as my heart with a big tan head and lots of lacing . i really do think dark beers are the nicest to behold .  mouthfeel : truly phenomenal creamy medium body with the slightest touch of syrup likeness .
appearance : pours dark brown with a hint of red . the head is a nice frothy tan with good lacing .  the mouthfeel on this is exceptional , so smooth will alcohol masterfully controlled .

a : i love the look of this beer : extremely dark brown with a huge tight foam head .  m- big , full body ... oily , almost syrupy with unattenuated sugars . very chewy , and it coats the mouth so well . just wonderful .

a very pricey brew in my area , with a four-pack going for nearly $ 13 ... was shrewd enough to pick up a single 12oz bottle which still ran me a hefty $ 3.50 ... pours a beautiful , dark , mahogany-brown tan color that resulted in a fluffy white head that had some staying power ... smell is malty , with a prunish aroma ... taste is very complex with an almost root-beer , licorice flavor that tingled on my tongue for awhile after the first-sip ... i really enjoyed this brew , put for the price , not sure i 'd pay again unless i could find a single ... definitely interested in the pale version from this brewery ... the taste is sweet , but an alcohol presence is certainly noticeable.. a good brew , definitely recommended ... .  m - fairly heavy body and solid flavors with moderate carbonation . the flavors are spot , the mouthfeel is amazing and its very drinkable .
nice head , rocky and just off-white . great lacing .  mouthfeel is fantastic ... light , dry , well carbonated , and quite bitter .
poured into tulip with a large white head that thins out into lacing . this is much lighter in color than i expected . very impressive appearance .  m - perfect . it 's velvet on the tongue .

appearance- beer pours clear and golden with a half finger of creamy white head with ample lacing on the sides of the glass . carbonation rises from the bottom of the glass as if this were a pilsner . very nice on looks at least .  mouthfeel : it is crisp , light , and perfectly carbonated .
the beer looks very good poured into a shaped pint . perfect tan-white head .  '' love the mouthfeel .

i waited , then gave a slow pour , and still got 3x more head than beer into my glass . pitch black and with a bubblebath of dark beige head that eventually settled as a thin layer .  mouthfeel is extremely smooth & this is a perfect beer to sip on on a lazy pm with no kids in sight !

a : poured perfectly dark brown with an abundant creamy light brown head . great retention and fantastic lacing .  s - sweet malt , molasses , licorice and red grapes t - sweet dark malt and licorice with a pleasant spice finish m - strong carbonation with a chalky finish that subdues the strong alcohol taste nicely d - very strong licorice and spice flavors combined with a great mouthfeel that balances the alcohol

a - pours black with a creamy tan head that dissipates fairly quickly to a thin , but dense , covering . good amount of lacing left behind .  body is the best part of this brew . flavors are all in check , mouthfeel is full and fat , with a straw-like dryness at the finish . this beer is exceptionally drinkable .
looks fantastic ! the head leaves plenty of lace after a couple of minutes .  m : awesomely smooth .

the haze really detracted from the appearance for me ... ... but it made up for the look with the smell . i honestly smelled this for a few minutes before tasting . the smell was very citrus like , with lots of malt and hop spice .  wonderful body .

poured from a 750ml bottle into my troubadour tulip glass . a dense and enormous mattress of foam tops the ale almost like a merengue . a sudsy lattice-work of lace remains in the glass even after it is empty .  the mouthfeel was awesome with silky smooth liquid and superb carbonation .

very aromatic . t - chewy malts with the same fruity ester present in the nose .  the texture on this is great . with the silky texture and sweetness , this is a good sipper , but nothing you 'd have more than 2 of in a single sitting .

poured into a tulip a nice dark brown color , nice carbonation , awesome fuckn ' head , never seen a head like this from a bw , two-finger creamy tannish head , tons of sticky lacing and islands through out the drink .  what got me hooked was how smooth and creamy this beer was . fantastic . this beer is by far one of the richest and creamiest beers i have ever had .

pours a crude oil black with a phenomenal caramel tan mocha head that is incredible , the cake laced froth will coat the glass throughout the session .  caramel , mocha , strong booze , brown sugar , raisins , figs , chocalate t-malt , mocha , booze , brown sugar , caramel , raisins figs , chocalate m-spicy , creamy , thick , barely carbonated d- pretty thick & filling .

a : into a champagne flute glass this yields a clear and bright orange golden color under a great head with an impressive carbonation .  the light bodied liquid is easily gulped down and that jusssttt perfect carbonation tickles the tongue making for an extremely thirst-quenching and refreshing pilsner .

stellar appearance with this beer . it pours a really nice orange amber color with fine yeast particles suspended in it like stars . very attractive .  the mouthfeel is absolutely perfect for a porter , so smooth and silky .

it had an excellent , crisp citrus kind of scent to it . very sweet , very unique . i did n't love it , but appreciated how different it was .  mouthfeel : wonderful balance all over the pallets and each taste-bud . the slightly raised abv can give cause to the minor warmth in mouthfeel .

22oz bottle ... a : a deep very dark ruby colored with a huge 2+ inch tan head that fades at a decent pace .  silky smooth thick bodied with a perfect amount of light carbonation and a ridiculously long lasting , balanced tart and sweet aftertaste .

i thought this beer looked excellent . nice craggy , tight head , with tons of lacing . golden colour , nice looking .  m - smooth , silky , full body with the perfect amount of carbonation o - great brew !

clear straw with a dash of red thrown in , the luscious billowing head practically crawls down the side of the glass like spider webs getting torn from a window .  m- the mouth feel is excellent for this beer .

this beer looks great in my mug with a great black body and a thick coffe colored head .  the mouth feel is awesome . i let a full gulp roll around from cheek to cheek just to let my tongue play in the surf .

poured into my big family guy mug and was greeted with one of the best looking heads i 've ever seen in that mug . perfect ruddy brown with a hint of mbver red , just like a bock should . nice and opaque too , hard to see any bubbles in there .  it 's as smooth as silk - perfectly suited as a dinner and desert sipper and easily the best porter i 've had the pleasure of tasting .

the pour is beautiful . intense rich brown/black , with a two finger dark brown head .  the malt is well back but the beer still has a nice light body . the palate is a great balance of all that and a nice honey quality in the background .

the sweet malts balance this very nicely . m & d : medium body beer , nice level of carbonation , makes for a semi-creamy mouthfeel . just an outstanding ipa .  it 's exceptionally smooth with little carbonation .

this brew pours an opaque black color . the head is large , and fluffy with a color of white speckled with tan .  m : an incredibly thick body and big , foamy carbonation . i love the way this feels .
back to the smell - oak , but the lovely old sort . . .  mouthfeel : so smooth and creamy . very refreshing .

aroma smacks you . good and hard . hops and oak would be an obvious statement . my notes indicate an amazing floral and woody perfume aroma . initial flavor is upfront pine and sweetness .  wonderful mouthfeel .

this beer black and entirely opaque with a thick and persistant off-white head with flecks of tan in it - very nice looking beer .  the texture is amazing . thick and silky , but because of the low abv , drinking this is just too easy .

bottle comes a fantastic cascading pour producing a thick , frothy tan head atop a translucent , deep brown body .  the mouthfeel is smooth and nicely done . excellent carbonation drinkability is good as well .
impressive retention , plenty of lacing .  the mouthfeel is great and smooth as can be .
appearance - slightly cloudy amber body . rocky two finger offwhite head with good stick and retention .  great mouthfeel - full yet fluffy , almost leaving my tongue numb .

nola brown ale , draft a big thick rocky head , deep ruby red color when held to the light . a nice looking beer .  a very heavy body that is infinitely swishable in your mouth and extremely creamy . this beer is truly fascinating .

somewhere there is a aroma i ca n't describe , but it is very familiar . marvelous aroma , but it ca n't keep that promise .  the smoothness of the beer is very impressive , exceptional smoothness in what has to be a rather potent brew .

a : nice brown body with a fluffy 1+ finger head that lasted forever .  the best thing about this brew is the mouthfeel , which is thick and expands as it moves across the tongue to the back of the mouth . modestly drinkable , but with this great thick mouthfeel , it 's one to be savored slowly .

had this at a recent ba gathering at milly 's , and brought a growler home . this is a beautiful beer : as black as can be , with a thick coffee-colored head .  m- incredibly smooth with a nice carbonation .

this beer proves that looks are n't everything . pours an utterly marvellous cloudy yellowish gold under a stupendous off-white head that grows and billows into spectacular cumulous clouds of foam on top of the liquid . this head lingers long and leaves very nice lace . ca n't really ask for more in a wheat beer 's appearance . the mouth starts off prickly , but goes flat like magic even before you can swallow . after the beautiful vision , the reality was quite disappointing .  mouthfeel is absurdly rich and creamy , silky smooth and slurpalicious . ) it 's the best feature of this brew . i mean , i like the taste , love the mouthfeel , and would enjoy having two or three of these , but that abv is on the high end .

browning 's bourbon barrel imperial stout pours a very nice , pitch black into a snifter with a small , light tan head that leaves lots of lacing behing .  m : medium bodied with a good amount of carbonation . exceptional in this category . appearance and mouthfeel are certainly worth noting .

pores black with a thick tan foamy head about 2in .  m : great , chewy and resiny , full-bodied and robust , with a smooth finish , compared to the rest of the sip , just what i 'm looking for in a double ipa .
appearance : hazy golden orange . effervescent body with a thick pillowy , white head that just wo n't quite .  m : glorious . so creamy and good . reminds me of a cask pour .

it looks good , always being ( in my experience ) in a nitro can or on nitro tap . it has an almost black body with an even , medium , creamy light tan head that lasts a long time .  amazing mouthfeel . viscous , rich and creamy without being syrupy .
pours a fluffy/clingy finger and a half light tan head over a crystal clear dark rust brownish liquid .  m : the best feature of this beer . rich , creamy , and silky as it goes down .

a - two fingers of off-white head slowly fade on top of a gorgeous translucent amber beer with bubbles rising steadily through it s - smell is a juicy blend of citrus and apricot , grapefruit is most prominent but plenty of orange zest comes through , apricot is muted and there 's a little bit of mint and pine in there too , do n't get too much aroma from the malts , a touch of toffee maybe t - flavor is far too muted considering that the beer is so appealing to the eyes and the nose , a touch of sweetness , a lot of hop bitterness , some grapefruit and orange , some apricot , but so subdued m - nice tongue coating from the hops but the carbonation is a little prickly , not as smooth as it could be o - not a bad ipa , not a great ipa .  mouthfeel is very crisp and smooth with some thickness from the yeast and bite from the hops .
dark golden yellow . thickish head . excellent lacing .  excellent ! incredible smooth and silky mouthfeel .

pour : 750ml bottle to tulip glass . tons of webbing shows how big the head had been , like the water line of a flood . beautiful .  extreme balance and smoothness in this beer , its quite good . big full body with a champaign like fizzyness . im impressed .

a- bright , vibrant copper/gold with a huge active head . this beer has sea foam on it . clumps of foam stuck to the top as i drink down .  first sip reveals a soft creamy texture with mild rolling carbonation .

very good lacing & head retention smell : slight malt hints taste : slight caramel followed by malt & fruiityness .  all kinds of malty goodness going on here - silky smooth , slightly pinpoint carbonation .

this beer pours a gorgeous clear deep orange amber color with a 3 finger ( on an easy pour ) of offwhite/tannish thick sudsy head . the head retention on this was ridiculous !  entering the mouth , i immediately take notice of the huge mouthfeel on this . this is fluffy , powdery , quaffable , and has this charming soft carbonation that is typical of great beers . palate displays a superb spicy bitterness executed in incredible balance and harmony ( this and the mouthfeel are the 2 attractions imo ) , gentle woodiness .

poured into a founders tumbler the beer looks beautiful . hazy brownish orange body with a beautiful bubbly head that recedes to a sticky big bubble film that does not go away . i just love this .  full , thick , rich mouth feel .

best by date of 5/3/11 a : standard pour yields a billowy 2.5 finger light creamsicle colored head with very good retention . lacing is patchy and spotty with nice cling .  mouthfeel is where this one shines , smooth as can be and perfectly carbonated , a light yet creamy quality .
a- big tan head on a clear deep amber body with hues of brown in it . nice lacing that sticks to side of glass .  the mouthfeel on this beer is almost perfect . a nice smooth drinkable beer .
almost black ( ruby red highlights ) with a nice brown head that leaves sheets of lace .  this beer feels absolutely perfect in the mouth .
it is a very pretty looking beer when poured into a pils glass . straw blonde colour with a thick white head that lingers for a while .  smooth and rich on the tongue .

a - hazy , orangish yellow body topped by a huge , rocky head with the most spectacular retention i have ever seen .  thin in the mouth but heavy on the tongue . perfect for the style and the season .
looks fantastic and inviting .  mouthfeel : exceptionally smooth and silky as can be .

very good . taste : like the smell , there 's lots of clove and sweet malt .  thick with just a little bit of slickness and just enough carbonation . sly fox oatmeal stout is a solid beer with a fantastic mouthfeel ; probably something i would order again .

appearance this one poured a beautiful , hazy orange in color with a monster head that i had to control at the pour . it came down pitting , leaving a whitish film all along the inside of my glass .  mouthfeel- medium bodied ale for sure and had small amount of carbonation . very creamy , and left a easy feel on the tongue .

pitch black beer with creamy tan head , good retention and plenty of lacing .  the aroma speaks strongly of roasted grains , as you would expect from a stout , while on the tongue the beer has tremendous body .

pours a thick creamy head and has a dark brown color with hints of amber .  regular boris has the most incredible smooth palate and this follows suit . so silky smooth from the oatmeal . definitely an interest beer for this alone .

as the foamy head settles it leaves a volcano like bump in the middle with the sides of the glass receding more steadily . very nice coper color . sticky lacing as the head recedes . o- this started out as a gorgeous beer , but as i got to know her a bit better her beauty began to fade .  m : the feel is exactly how i like my imperial stouts . there is a decent amount of carbonation in there as well .
a - black ad pitch .  one of the best mouthfuls ever !

aroma is big sweet , multitudes of dark fruit , caramel and quiet peat moss . quadish exceptional highly complex flavor , something for everyone . sweetness not equal to the expectation from the nose . the evolution of the taste is significant .  mouthfeel is really impressive . very gradual on the tongue and extraordinarily balanced .
smell- very fresh malts give a whiff of roast , toast , and even some plums .  great bubbly mouthfeel , no aftertaste at all .
pours a deliciously cloudy , rich red with a nice thick & dark tan head .  m- really interesting . a dry feeling on the sides of the tongue and a sweet feeling in the back . really well done .

appearance : nice maple syrup/caramel bronze , it matched really well with the polished bronze colored bar where i was sitting .  finishes dry with nice mocha notes & a touch of charred grain mf : very oily & smooth as all hell with low carbonation & nice stickyness .
the appearance is a perfect amber .  moderate body , excellent smoothness .
a : pours to a frothey tan head with a deep and beautiful copper body . excellent lacing .  the carbonation is just right here .
a- pretty beautiful . a reddish amber color , just glowing .  the mouthfeel was awesome - very creamy and full bodied .
it poured with a huge , frothy , clumpy , and sticky head that was the darkest brown i 've ever seen .  mouthfeel - smooth , evenly carbonated , and a perfectly solid body .
its pours a beautiful copper with a thick white head .  super creamy mouthfeel w/o any overcarbed bite .
this beer is a handsome black with a pillowy light tan head that has great retention and lacing .  mouthfeel is medium-thick but amazingly silky . carbonation is moderate .

a brown top with long legs to match . awesome . a beer that is overpowered and buttered with palo santo wood is one that attacks the palette . not a fan of the hints of sweetness here either . mouthfeel was average , but feeling over carbonated for this suite of flavors .  m- mouthfeel on this is incredible . medium to full bodied , chewy and creamy , moist , and not a hint of alcoholic bite .
pours with a big foamy white head . fades to 1/2 finger and has great retention from there .  m/d : a full body that is creamy and velvety smooth .
appearance- deep brown-caramel colored pour . leaves wonderful lace streaks and patches . almost the entire glass was caked with lace after i was finished .  m= perfect dryness and crispness .

beautiful nitro thick creamy tan head over a black body . has a lovely way of settling to a creamy solid chunk that wo n't spill out of the glass if you tilt it .  m : full-bodied and lightly carbonated with a soft and creamy texture . alcohol noticable in a nice warming effect .

a big frothy white head that sticks around forever , and then leaves some pretty sticky lace on the glass . a very pretty beer , love head .  m - creamy and rich . the carbonation is very laidback ... almost feels as if it floats on the tongue . very soft ... puffy , in a way .

aroma : coffee and chocolate malt meld accented by a whiff of hops and a touch of smoke . nice complexity and balance leads to a very appealing invitation . overall impression : thick and creamy with a wonderful nose . unfortunately the taste just didnt live up to the billing .  m - amazing . low to moderate carbonation ( expected ) and full bodied .

pours out very clear straw color with plenty of carbonation and a rich frothy white head that lingers and laces , truly beautiful .  a very smooth , luxurious malt backbone enhances the mouthfeel , but a bitter smack of hops reminds me that i 'm drinking an ipa . quite enjoyable .
aromas are fantastic ( pure wild ale ) . plenty of interesting aroma & flavor , and smooth going down .  feels wonderful on the tongue , perfect for a summer or spring day .

08.08 fresh / dated 07.10.08 pours nicely with a fair amount of carbonation building a nicely formed loose head that has some staying power .  loved the residual stickiness . d- it 's remarkable how fff can make such big beers and hide the alcohol so well .

s- a little woody , sweet malt with a real nice smell very nice t- has a very earthy taste , kinda a bit of caramel but some definet wood tones , spicy , maybe a little cinnamon . pretty good but caramel isnt a personal favorite flavor m- kinda light for its darkness but overall a medium body pretty solid , hits the tongue well and lingers a little while d- a nice beer , the caramel isnta personal like but for those who do its a really good beer  m : as expected it has a wonderful feel to it that only a belgian can give . thick and creamy with a medium weight that gives way to an extremely crisp finish .
an ending swirl murks up the brew nicely . massive thick and rich eggshell ice-cream topping floating on top .  medium bodied , excellent mouthfeel .

a : pours a dark , um , brown in the glass with some light penetration indicating it 's not opaque . the head is pretty fizzy , with two fingers of creamy beige bubbles generated at first , before receding into a half-finger cap on top of the brew . some streaks of lacing as i drink .  mouthfeel is where this beer really shines , and makes one understand why some folks are such lager fans . the balance in this beer is amazing , with everything seemingly in the right preportion .
pours a nice red amber with a towering white creamy head ... just like every other nitro beer .  m- great mouthfeel .

half inch of dense creme colored head . brown in color with an orange glow when held to light . good lacing and a welcomed layer of retention after settling .  starts with roasted coffee flavor , mouthfeel is incredible smooth .
the head is big , small bubbles below , big ones in the middle and a nice cream dome on top .  m- very , very thick and chewy . also quite heavy .

in a snifter at falling rock in denver on 9/12/11 a - exceptional head , white and everlasting . decent lace .  the mouthfeel is outstanding . substantial , but not quite so thick as to confuse it with a stout .
on initial pour this is one of the finest looking brews i 've ever laid eyes on .  mouth feel is incredible with some good champagne bubbling going on .
pours a copper/red color , nice big fluffy head to it that sticks around with a lot of lacing .  mouthfeel very full and smooth .

this one pours a hazy yellowish orange with a white head that just will not go away . looks great overall .  extremely smooth tasting beer . bodied is so full its nearly chewable . mouthfeel is full and round . finish is clean and very smooth .
makes a great looking beer for sure .  m- extremely smooth with the right amount of carbonation d- this one goes down too easily .
perfect deep burgundy in color with a large , creamy and dense head of light tan foam .  matches perfectly with the thickness of the body .

the way the carbonation and creamy foam mixes with the super dark body of the beer is gorgeous . through the glass , it looked like the bubbles were cascading like a waterfall , only upwards . anyway , the body is opaque and the head is super creamy and tan in apprearance . the head stuck around for a long time and left decent lacing .  super easy going down with a perfect dry finish .

looks great with a two finger thick off white head , and has a nicely filtered copper colored body .  in the mouth , the tiny bubbles announce and incredibly smooth and balanced beer , with a roasted , slightly sweet flavor .
pillowy head lasts well , and lacing is surprising nice , with heavy foam coverage .  great palate , though . even when it gets warm , great warmth and sliky smooth syrups .

beer is a dark , dark color , with just the slightest hints of ruby at the edges and a coffee colored head . beautiful to look at , and almost as nice to drink .  the carbonation is spot on and helps bring the subtle notes of roast to the front . this also makes this beer one of the best feeling brews i 've ever had .

got this one in trade , thanks eric ... a : perfect look . thick 1 and 1/2 inch off-white head that slowly fades leaving nice lacing around the glass .  the first thing i noticed actually was the incredible mouthfeel .

poured into a fluted pilsner glass , this czech pils showed an exceptional ability to form a stiff , meringue-like , rocky head of foam . retention was great , lasting for the duration of the glass , leaving irregular clumps of foam on the way down .  m - thick , very smooth and very viscous with little carbonation .

just an absolutely pitch black beer that poured like motor oil and had one of the darkest , longest lasting heads i have seen on an imperial stout .  perhaps there is similar inconsistency here , and i will be wowed by the bottles i brought home sometime in the future ... mouthfeel is by far the best characteristic , supple , creamy and light .

poured a very nice deep copper with fantastic head and nice lacing .  big , viscous mouthfeel does great things for this beer , transmitting a pretty large package ( 10 % , significant ibu count ) into an easy-to-sip package .

a- nice pour into a standard pint glass , about 3 fingers of nice creamy/airy/cloudy head , great release . deep rasberryish/velvety red rusty color . nice consistent lacing throughout .  the mouthfeel is light , with excellent particulates that roam the mouth . a most excellent brew that i would n't hesitate to try again .

gorgeous , classy looking beer .  bordering on chewy as you work toward swallowing . carbonation was excellent on tap , just enough to contribute to a dry and clean finish despite the initial sweetness of the beer .

pours a lovely , crystal clear dark amber color with a nice 1/2 '' tan head that persists all the way down , coating the entire glass with heavy lacing . the best looking ipa i 've ever seen .  mouthfeel is full but not too heavy .
they are the best ! beautiful pour , orangish tan with a perfect beige head .  m : rich and creamy . very chewy and thick . little carbonation .
a quick swirl brings nice crimson flashes to the glass , quite amazing ... the aroma flows to my nostrils from feet away .  perfect carbonation to it .
a : the pour is deep deep burgundy with a really large thick creamy off-white head . the slow dissipation leaves lacings galore .  m - huge , thick , syrupy , creamy , perfect carbonation .
huge , billowy head of marshmallow fluff is perfectly `` belgian '' - big foamy clumps of lace are all over my glass .  perfectly constructed mouthfeel for a schwarzbier .

big , frothy , sponge-like head towers over the brew and new fully disappears .  the mouthfeel on this ale was great , and i think the mouthfeel of just about any beer is enhanced by cask conditioning . it had a nice thick feel on the tongue .
pours thick and pitch black , no light can penetrate this . has a nice sized brown head that fades to medium ring that leaves an awesome lace .  palate duration is excellent . medium body .
a - pours a nice amber color . ended up with a generous inch of head that stuck around for a little while . lacing was good .  mouthfeel is rich and creamy .

my bottle looks different than the picture ; guess they changed the label . appearance : clear light amber with a big frothy head of light tan .  m- great mouth feel . very smooth and not over-carbonated .

a - classic dark bronze doppelbock color .  t- the taste is starts out very smooth and creamy from the mouthfeel with some of roasted malts quickly followed by a nice bitter finish . m- the mouthfeel is silky smooth from the oatmeal with a moderate amount of carbonation . d- very good stuff , and not too boozy for a 9 % beer even though you can feel the warmth .

pours a nice deep brown murky color , with some red note showing thru , nice rich belgian look to it . head is rich nice fluffy tan that last and lasts finally falls to ringed scum that laces all the way down .  mild-medium carbonation just enough to excite the palate . to me , this is almost the perfect mouthfeel .
huge four finger mocha head . really not all that impressive .  the feel is big and thick .

the color is dark brown , almost black , with a beautiful light-brown , creamy and thick head , that reduced to a nice thin lacing after several minutes .  smooth , airy , luscious , divine mouthfeel . tremendous ! a wonderful bsda .
a - pours a dark , murky brown with ruby highlights .  mouthfeel is just perfect . the way this thing finishes it has a slight peppery aspect but it is dry and clean .
it 's a solid gold with a sprightly white head .  mouthfeel is heavy and smooth with a small amount of carbonation , very nice .
young 's double chocolate stout pours super dark with an excellent thick tan head that remains until the beer is gone .  mouthfeel is probably the best part of this beer .
a-pale straw color with a very thick white head that leaves outstanding lacing on the glass .  mouthfeel : thick and smooth in every sense of the words -- a very pleasant experience indeed !
appearance : pours a black color with a huge light tan head .  mouthfeel is so big thick and creamy .
served in a pint glass , it pours dark brown with some tinges of ruby red in there when i hold it up to the light .  beautiful .

thanks for the opportunity ... poured into an imperial pint glass , formed a 1/4 '' dark brown ( almost purply black ) head above the opaque black brew . head hangs on , with average lace , which actually is pretty good for the style .  m- awesome thick mouthfeel on this seasonal .
appearance : gorgeous beer with strong lacing throughout the entire glass . it looked sooo good , but there is almost no aroma .  the body is just fantastic : full , creamy and smooth .
s - sweet fruit and malt smell with some alcohol .  mouthfeel is perfect . not too thick and good carbonation .
big bulky beige head 1 1/2 inches . a thin head remains throughout no matter how long it sits ( very nice ) .  full bodied and silky .
the head is a huge and fluffy 3 fingers high cloud puff with great retention and excellent lace .  very full body that stretches the cheeks . just such chewy hops .
a pretty good looking beer .  m : the carbonation on this one is perfect . perfect mouthfeel .

pours a dark brown with a healthy sandy light tan head that lingers at a fairly thick level and laces the glass heavily .  m : very viscous and full . smooth carbonation and a nice stickyness make the mouthfeel very complimenting to the taste .
