poured from the bottle into a sam adams sensory glass . a : a beautiful pillowy head sits atop a clear , deep brownish copper , with great carbonation . perfect and appetizing .  m : very soft , finely carbonated medium body .
the beer pours amazingly dark reddish purple with a creamy purple head of 3 cm foaming up easily .  mouthfeel is perfect -- light but not watery , highly carbonated ... perfect for the style .

nose is fantastic - fruity and bitter , a bit earthy/grassy and just a tinge of honey sweetness ( think hopslam ) .  the first thing one notices , upon pouring , is the consistency : this beer appears thicker than most , and may or may not have legs , likely a contributing factor to this beers exceptional mouthfeel .

330ml bottle poured into tulip dec9 2010 a super hazy golden orange with tiny suspended particles being move around by a shitload of bubbles . a gentle pour leaves a massive 3 finger head that forms a dome over the top of the glass and just sits there for a while ever so slowly falling to a thick film with a island in the middle that looks like a little brain s a little yeast and pineapple with some other fruits i ca n't quite place and some booze t what i smell but with a little more booze , some cereals and a nice little blast of hops .  smells like a smoke beer ... .i get a little chocolate in the nose ... but the roasted smell is overpowering ... taste is sweet on the front end ... and an overall smooth taste ... .with a little bitterness on the back end ... very nice feel ... .creamy and smooth perfect for the style ... .velvet like smoothness ... drinkability is not bad ... although it is a stout and it weighs you down ...
a- amazing head retention on the big , white head that is very sticky ; body is gold body with red tints .  solid mouthfeel , smooth and dense with animated carbonation .

i took a picture of it because it just looked like a perfect beer to me . that nice dark brown/black with creamy head on top just looks beautiful . not too much in the nose , little bready but nothing else jumps out at me .  the alcohol is kept well in check allowing the finish to cascade over the palate with a ton of character and wonderful texture . strong , long finish .
this really is a lovely looking beer .  the mouthfeel is a true hallmark of this beer .

this is a beer you have once or twice and then just get it as the `` exotic '' for your gf to help justify the stuff you bought for yourself . pours a light pinkish-amber with a very very light pink fluffy head that faded quickly . if you like strawberries , which i do very much , then the smell and taste will immediately remind you of something more likely to be served at an orange julius or other shake/juice mixer .  initially the softness of the carbonation and the sweetness of the fruity flavors makes it like a sweet soda ( can anyone remember tahitian treat ? again with the yeast character and the near rancid presence ( the brett i presume ) , yet the overall soft flavors and soft feel are greatly appealing and enjoyable . the light , fine and bubbly carbonation brings an element of childhood fun to the drink ( how about fizzies , anyone remember that ) as it brings a tickle to the nose and tongue . light overall feel and great softness . soft and light and tasty ( again in a soda pop manner ) .

a- pours into my pint glass a light mahagony with a finger of bright foam . this trails into a lacing pattern that reminds me of a coral reef , quite beautiful .  a big sturdy body on this one ... no doubt held up by some quality malts used , gives way to a sublime smooth and velvety mouthfeel that has a slight crispness in the end . about perfect in every sense .
pours a pretty almost crystal clear pale orangish yellow with a nice two fingers of white foam topping it .  perfect ris mouthfeel .
pours a rich opaque sable with a fine-bubbled light tan head .  m - perfect . exactly how a dipa should be .
poured into a tall hobgoblin tumbler , there is a huge billowing light tan head . very impressive presentation .  solid body , creamy mouthfeel .

appearance : brilliant copper . huge creamy white head like a cloud in the sky that lasted a half an inch till the last drop .  mouthfeel : the mouthfeel is outstanding . it sparkles just enough to give the palate a good tickle , but not so much that it scrapes away all of its flavor .
this beer was very dark and had a creamy head that lasted a long time .  mouthfeel is very syrupy and very rich with a dense body .
opague black extremely heavy coffee colored heading . that leaves excellent lacing and keeps a nice collar all the way down to the last gulp .  so creamy and smooth it 's almost not a beer ...

one of the best looking beers . the cascade effect is great and the lasting tan head is inviting .  sour , some cherries , but most of all very tart and bone dry ; element of french cheese in it ( brie ) , some cream ; m : lovely alcohol , nice tartness , very drinkable ; o : not too complex but but very good kriek , which i will buy whenever i see it .
dugana pours beautifully for a 2.5 finger thick off white head , with great retention .  mouthfeel is heavy and smooth with a nice small bite of carbonation , wonderful .

i really do n't have anything too negative to say about this beer , it looks great and smells good .  a great take on belgium ale ; apples , pears , lemons , apricot and orange flavors nustle their way thru a carbonated full bodied swig .

there are references to ginger , spice , pumpkin and fresh wet hops . packaging says best before march 2012 . the beer is very cloudy and the color is along the lines of pumpkin pie .  the texture is rich and creamy and coasts your mouth in deliciousness .

2008 version pours a deep , rich-looking mahogany brown body . hazy . off-white , foamy head slowly fades with nice lacing . good looking smells up front of alcohol and hops .  perfect . d- a very unique pumpkin ale .

one and a half fingers of super creamy off-white head . excellent retention and lots of lacing . awesome !  mouthfeel was great , it was very rich and smooth with little carbonation but it fit the stout just right .

poured into an oversized wine glass producing a good two fingers worth of tan head with lots of lacing and looked mahogany in color .  only lightly effervescent , making the mouthfeel of this beer fantastic . i could n't picture the mouthfeel of this beer being any better . the amazing mouthfeel coupled with the well developed and super tasty character of this beer make it an easy drinker .
a : the pour is a deep dark brown , essentially black , with a fluffy tan head .  the mouthfeel is perfect for the style ; adequately carbonated and finished silky and creamy .
makes an impressive appearance , a nice red amber color with a large foamy pale head that lingers in the chalice with some sticking .  mouthfeel is great . just the right level of thickness here .

cola colored perhaps . head is tan , lasts well , and leaves lacing . m- carbonation is medium-light , but dang , for a porter this has a thin body .  very full in the mouth , coating , oily bitterness lingering and alcohol warmth continues to expand over my palate , throat , stomach as i enjoy this beer .
pours a very nice black color with some ruby hues and a thick white head . i love to watch this beer settle .  mouthfeel is medium bodied , very smooth and creamy . overall this is pretty damn good .
a - pours 2 fingers of thick tan head that has great retention and leaves a little bit of clinging lace .  unbelievably smooth . feel is so outstanding for a heavy dark lager .

looks like a ton of carbonation . golden , cloudy . great looking beer and i 'm excited to taste my first jolly pumpkin .  taste- for a double ipa , this beer is not on a mission to wreck the palate ... with so much flavor i 'm surprised that the malts weigh in so heavily . solid . it 's sudsy ( the name of my beloved late parakeet ) and sublime . drinkability- one real attribute about this bruiser of a beer is that the abv ( 10 % ) is completely hidden ... it 's nowhere in any of the above categories . this is more like a nectar , thick and juicy , garnering respect for each sip .
it was not , however , all that interesting . great black color but overall not much in the way of belgian character .  the mouthfeel is great , nice and thick and perfectly carbonated .

lovely hue , a truly good bright ruby red , with a collapsing , but pleasantly silky head of yellow white . it 's a really lovely looking american red ale , absolutely what you want from the style .  mouthfeel is lucious : creamy and oily , rich in the mouth , but smooth enough to want more and more .
pours smooth and deep , with a nice creamy off-white head . great appearance , large dark oily brown head .  the moutfeel is exceptional - full bodied and thick with appropriate carbonation .

a nice cloud of white head that really sticks around and leaves nice lacing . beautiful in the glass and that nice tart , musty funky taste .  the carbonation is fantastic -- beer feels creamy and smooth- almost velvety .

pours pitch black like guinness . smells extremely strong of caramel and a hint of mint ( i 'm thinking of mint chocolate chip ice cream ) .  mouthfeel : a smooth sugary viscous mouthfeel that is balanced nicely by the carbonation .
pours a deep , opaque blood red with a really pretty cotton candy , rosy head that settled into a soapy haze .  exceptional mouthfeel and drinkability .

so dark you could hide a black sheep in it . cute labeling , special bottle , and usda organic slapped on it make it stick out yet it yields something akin to canadian made guinness .  m : a great , great medium body , that grazes you at the tail with sharp carbonation .

appearance : pours an off-white , two-finger head with good retention . even , abundant lace left on glass .  m-grand canyon deep and gordian knot complex . amazingly tantalizing on the palate . while it looks still in the glass it bursts with palate stimulating carbonation with each sip . like an amusement park in your mouth ! this is a highly enjoyable and palate stimulating sipper . a mighty fine drinking brew .
dark brown in color and the tan head retains its character well .  like other fine belgian beers the carbonation produces a surreal creamy consistency that serves to deliver maximum taste .
had a wonderful dark amber color , but it was a mirage with no soul .  really coats the mouth for an excellent mouthfeel .

appearance - black with murky auburn brown edges . nice semi tan head with great retention and lacing . super sticky on the sides , just beautiful .  mouthfeel is very delicious with some creamy notes but some nice crisps and sharp grassy hop notes .

dark copper with a 2 finger off-white head from a 22 into a pint glass . i drink slower , so i poured the remainder almost 30 minutes later and it still formed a 2 finger head . this is much lighter in the smoke than any rauch that most people have had .  the feeling in your mouth , however is gorgeous ! smooth , silky , incredible.. so incredibly good that i actually said 'incredible ' in a french accent because it deserved such smoothness ... i 'm not going to lie , as for drinkability.. i 'm not as into this as anchor 's or even sierra nevada 's , christmas offerings this year , but it is still very drinkable to this lass .
a - frothy and thick white head standing a couple inches tall with awesome stamina . the body is a hazy yellow .  body is medium-full for style , and this is just about perfect on the way down .

it 's supposedly a witbier heavily flavored with raspberries -- and just a touch of honey . the berry aroma is all-consuming . 8 inches from my nose , it 's attacking my nostrils like a schoolbully . if i 'm picking raspberry seeds out of my teeth with new glarus rapsberry tart or lindemans framboise , i 'm picking the raspberry jolly rancher wrapper out of my teeth with this one . intensely fruity .  mouthfeel is just perfect - thick , rich , and creamy , with a slightly oily sheen that coats the mouth and throat .
appearance is beautiful . pours an oaky golden light brown . leaving a dense one finger head on top of the beer .  very palatable and no alcohol taste at all m - silky smooth , great carbonation .
appearance : clean , clear golden body . very nice looking .  it 's thick , creamy , rich , and robust .

a- pours a good looking deep brown with a little light let in around the edges . a big 1.5 fingered mocha colored head leaves some good lacing on the side of the glass all the way down .  the mouthfeel is great on this one too , effervescent and full at the same time .
a : pours a dark black with a massively thick mocha head that seems to last forever ... excellent lacing throughout .  mouth is rich and sticky yet wonderfully smooth .

s : smell is the best part of this beer in my opinion . strong scent of hops . reminds me of some other good intoxicating herbs . i really love this hoppy goodness !  this brew is a tremendously creamy medium-body with a tantalizing , light bite about the tongue what can i say !
as black as an overcast night in the woods with no light . thick creamy , milky , tan head .  m - perfect for a porter .
2003 : nice heavy white head tops the cloudy golden hue .  mouthfeel is super creamy and silky smooth .

pours a nice amber color with a white head and excellent lacing .  ( not a huge coffee stout fan ) ( blasphemous i know ) the greatest thing about this beer is the smooth creamy texture that is present while drinking .

appearance : dark brown to black , almost opaque . pouring leaves a thick tan head that takes a while to go away and an island of foam that remains the entire time .  while there was no head , the carbonation is just right ; the body is no thinner or heavier than it should be .
poured into an ommegang chalice a reddish/purplish brown color with a solid half-inch of head.. perfect for the style .  perfect . d- a remarkably smooth beer , although a bit mild .

750ml corked bottle poured into a tulip glass . ( a ) - pours a hazy golden yellow color that produced a huge 2+finger fluffy white head with fantastic retention . it is sticking to the glass in webs as it dissipated .  m- the mouthfeel is full bodied with a perfect amount of carbonation .

bottle courtesy of kegbear : poured a bright golden yellow color ale with a pure white large foamy head with great retention and perfect lacing .  mouthfeel is exceptional ! this beer is smooth , silky , creamy .

the beer poured in a dutch beerglass gives a very nice white head with a dark coppercouloured fluid . the smeel is average , ca n't really say what smells reach out my nose but it 's not spectacular .  mouthfeel was creamy and exceptional . i was surprised to be able to drink the whole thing since i am not a fan of coffee at all , but this was a pleasant change of pace for me .

consumed 2 days later a : poured a deep maroon color with good carbonation and a dirty white head s : caramel .  the mouthfeel of this beer might be its most remarkable consistency ; velvety , silken slickness .
pours a deep chestnut with a thick white head which dissipates pretty quickly but leaves some nice lacing .  m- creamy and full-bodied . what else would you expect from the style ?
very pretty in the glass , big foam head that would n't quit through the whole bottle . heavy orange color .  mouthfeel is full bodied and smooth that feels pretty creamy on the tongue .
aroma is a deep roasted scent that makes me think of chocolate cake baking . color is solid black with good carbonation and a thick tight head .  m - perfect carbonation . awesome smoothness . dry .

appears to be mostly opaque ? brown frothy head , provided 1 1/2 finger on a vigorous pour . good retention and nice lacing as the head slowly reduced .  mouthfeel is astonishingly smooth and creamy for such a rich , complex ale .
dark black with creamy tan head that leaves great retention and foamy lace .  the mouthfeel is oh so smooth and creamy , just perfect !

nose : this thing has everything : an early combination of chocolate , caramel , and nuts presents a whole pecan pie on a silver platter . all this is followed by some dark chocolate covered cherries and fruitcake aroma . it has a sweet plastic lasting flavor that warns off any hops . has a bit of a smoky swallow which is nice , but does n't mellow the bubble gum . this one is getting thrown behind bars for 3-5 - then we 'll see if it 's more under control .  m : the mouthfeel is what really sold me on this beer .

pours out like chocolate syrup , fills the glass pitch black with a very dark tan head . billowing foam despite a very cold serving temperature , thick chunks of lace , crazy retention .  t- pretty solid all around . very smooth , robust , and thick .
it 's unfortunate that such an incredible looking beer would have so little else working for it . appearance - dark , brooding .  the mouthfeel is outstanding , substantial and even sticky .
poured into a fluted tulip glass , lots of sticky foam on the glowing orange body .  mouthfeel : perfection . the bead is neither too large nor too small .

a deep amber reddish beer with a mother of pearl head . the head on this brew is large fluffy , lasting and pungent .  mouthfeel is a heavy but perfect . heavy with lots of lactose , light but fizzi carbonation .

pours a dark , opaque mahogany tone with a solid finger and a half of a beige-colored head . decent retention , good lacing , and a lasting cap .  this beer 's greatest attrubite is , in fact , its spectacualrly creamy mouthfeel .

probably the prettiest lacing you will ever see on a glass . effing beautiful .  the mouthfeel is , in a word , glorious . smooth on the tip of the tongue , then seeming to evaporate off your tongue leaving a crisp , somewhat spicy finish .

aroma is exceptional , with a great sweet citrus smell that bursts from the bottle and makes you want to take a huge gulp . this is n't a horrible beer , and if you love bitterness , you should love it .  so very soft on the palette - really a unique mouthfeel , just velvety smooth .

appearance - 5.0 pours two fingers of moussy cream coloured head which settled at a dense centimetre over a brilliantly clear body of amber-orange . left spots of lace all the way down the glass , gorgeous !  it is very creamy and very smooth . it 's like chocolate silk . very delicious .

a : this pours a lovely cloudy golden/orange color . a huge foamy head forms and leaves tons of sticky lace down my snifter .  what i really loved was the mouthfeel . very good for a lager style beer .

a- poured into an over-sized beer mug , this made for a super robust head . great sticky lacing , a steady stream of carbonation , and an amber/orange body sets this beer up as one of the prettiest looking ipas ive seen in a while . s- i think the full scent has a bit of a hard time breaking through this super dense head !  the mouthfeel is fucking perfect : it 's thick and creamy .

it was truly beautiful , and left something more than lacing , almost a vanilla milkshake looking coating on the glass .  my favorite thing about this obviously the sweet rich malt character which adds to a very nice body for a beer of this alcohol content .

appearance : extremely voluptuous head , almost overflowing , with lots of carbonation and bubbles . color is pitch black , no nuances there .  the mouthfeel on this beer is great , so creamy with just enough bubbles that make it not to syrupy .
this beer looks perfect . theres not as much smell to this one as others like it .  full effervescent body , huge amounts of carbonation . an unusual beer that 's quite good .

snow-white head was thick and pillowy , and lingered through the entire drink , and reduced to excellent lacing up and down the glass .  mouthfeel : has a great mouthfeel . it has exceptional smoothness .

pours up a beautiful grapefruit color with a very thin white head .  this was the first belgian i ever had . it has a very creamy smoothness that i really love . finishes long and dry with more fruityness .

appearance- black ! ! ! creamy head .  the feeling is very nice , sticky and big , but not viscous and syrupy . really nice in that aspect . the carbonation was lively and enjoyable , made this one easy to drink .
pours dark brown with a hint of red and a moderate ring of pink foam .  the mouthfeel is full and warming , in fact , this beer is a huge belly warmer .

served in a pilsner glass a : pours a deep mahogany color that looks thick . pours with very thick white head and leaves considerable lacing s : very sweet smelling brew possibly of cherries .  m - medium body and low carbonation , so incredibly smooth . perfect mouthfeel .

a- c'mon ... its a guinness ... and i think this is one of the prettiest pouring beers out there . pours a dark coffee color , the head resembles whipped cream and is a khaki half a finger head . great traces of lacing all the way thru to the end .  super creamy mouthfeel , medium body and carbonation level .
a wonderfully thick head sits on top of an incredibly amber colored beer . my favorite look easily .  wonderfully smooth mouthfeel , but not much of anything else that would make this beer standout .

really , this is an outstanding looking beer .  but what might be the true feats here are , on the one hand , the quality and sock of the flavors given the abv , and the insanely creamy mouthfeel on the other .

i 've been avoiding this beer , but my wife bought me a sixer so here we go ... poured into a sa perfect pint glass , and it looks pretty good with mounds of soft and pillowy head , and a golden/slightly hazy body .  t : the taste was about average for a stout , almost identical in flavor to guinness m : amazing mouthfeel , so creamy and so smooth .
the body is orangish gold in color and is ultra hazy .  mouthfeel : amazing . creamy and smooth , thick .
it pours a decently frothy tan colored head .  m : wow ! just so damn smooth .

the beer looks really good with a thick brown creamy head , tons of lacing , and a very nice head that lasts and lasts .  rich roasty chocalaty with a fabulous creamy mouthfeel . mouth again is just amazing . another great brew by troegs .

pours a oil dark black with a big brown head .  bitter black chocolate moves into the woodiness and finishes boozy m- creamy , full-bodied , coats the mouth and boozy heat d- really impressed with this one .

pours a clear orange , chunks , one of the coolest looking heads ever , kind of a reverse cascading tan , head goes fast , some lace .  mouthfeel is exceptional . very smooth , great carbonation , but not enough to distract from the flavors going on .
a : the perfect clear orange color . great retention .  the mouthfeel , though , was the best part . it fills your mouth with mousse like consistency with very round edges .

12oz brown bottle . frothy and creamy off white 1 '' head that holds for a while , eventually leading to some nice layers of lacing . very deep mahogany color with a shade of brown .  complexity is not disturbed by the great thick airy body . thick enough that the high carbonation appears just smooth and creamy . it feels like theyve brewed it with oatmeal .
spectacular retention and thick , chunky lace .  great mouthfeel and is smooth on the palate with a hoppy bitterness that lasts forever .

espresso and chocolate aromas , with hints of vanilla , roast and brownies , quite the vibrant little blend of malt aromatics . slightly bitter and astringent malt , but still decadent and enjoyable , with chocolate and cream flavors .  wonderful full mouthfeel .

a massive , three-inch head rose up to the top of the tulip glass . lacework aplenty . a real beauty .  the feel is awesome . maybe it is the milk sugar , but something gives it an icy , silky feel that is wonderful . overall good , a beer that i would have one of on occasion .

12 oz bottle , unreadable stamping on cap , poured into a flute . a : poured a nice tan one fingered head . blackness with dark red shading on its edges , great lacing appears .  it seemed to just coat my whole mouth on its way down .

pours a completely opaque pitch black . light brown head with some big bubbles around the edges .  has that totally coating feel like a warm thick cask draught , just almost oily in its feel and velvety ( aside from the alcohol ) . really like this about this beer .
looks pretty nice , as did the bottle presentation , but is the beer nice ?  m : incredibly creamy leaving a nice coating around the mouth that tingles slightly .

when you crack the can open you can hear the tsss of the nitro kick in , then it pours a full pinto of nitro head which slowly ( but faster than on tap ) dissipates into the body . nose is a bit roasty and creamy , nice and smooth .  very full and creamy mouth . damn tasty .

bottle poured into my darkness glass ... a dark brown , just not yet turned black . a nice big creamy mocha head of at least three fingers , good retention and great lacing .  mouthfeel is truly wonderful , with a heavy , syrupy feel mixed in with a light tingle from some hidden carbonation and the alcohol itself .
smell : chocolate , lots of malt , good !  very smooth and full bodied mouthfeel , with medium carbonation .

appearance = ridiculous amount of head - like 5 to 6 inches of thick milky white froth and foam . looks pretty darn good ; i just need this one to settle .  the mouthfeel as mentioned earlier , is very thick and creamy . very little carbonation .

bright transparent golden hue with a two inch frothy white head . lots of bubbles and good lacing . perfect appearance .  first gulp of this was outstanding.. nice creamy , mouthfeel to it that just bombards your mouth with sweet , delicious beer flavor .

the pheasant pours a light , pale gold colour with a whopping four finger head !  the mouthfeel was exquisite . tiny bubbles caress , going a little foamy , opening the flavor as it hits the back of your mouth .

this porter pours with a dark brown to black body topped by a thick , light brown head with a good amount of lacing .  mouthfeel- the texture of this beer in the mouth is stunning and absolutely *perfect* .

some of shakespeare 's stuff is pretty dark , but shakespeare stout a nihilistic black , with a big head the color of creamy coffee . the little black bubbles peppering the head make it look alluringly like a chocolate chip cookie .  m : nice light body on it with mild carbonation , which was perfect for this style of ale .

pours to a bright copper color with thick white head that lingers throughout , and slowly diminishes to a white foam cap with excellent lacing .  this is one of the thickest beers i 've had . very heavy and smooth mouthfeel .

a- pours a deep black color with a huge , fluffy , brown head that leaves tons of lacing as it goes down .  mouth is very crisp and finishes clean , excellent carbonation . leaves a nice tingling on the tongue . drink is very good i usually would n't want an ipa for a session beer but this one i definetly would have a few more for the evening .

a - translucent , super vibrant golden straw color that could illuminate a room . finger eggshell ( always wanted to work that color into a review ! ) head with a nice bubbly ring and a thin white film of bubbles remains on the surface .  excellent balance and mouthfeel , could be a great session beer .

poured into pints : appearance : pours a deep rusted brown and is cloudy with an immense 2 1/2 finger , off-white , foamy head that fades and retains at a skim .  exactly how i like my stouts to feel -- heavy and chewy .

creamy khaki foam tops off this american porter , the surface has a light sheen to it , forming uneven crags and peaks that push above the rim . sticky lacing is left all around , clumped in almost cartoonish 3-d . cola ruby color in the light , with slow trails of carbonation .  the mouthfeel is dry with a long and deep finish which is full of blackened malt and char . very very nice .

this pours a beautiful chocalate brown with a thick 2 inch mocha malty head reminicent of a fine stoudt . the taste is mediocre slight hints of chocolate surrounded by the more obvious coffe malt flavors .  ideal texture for an ipa .

two fingers of thick , creamy baige head with great retention and tons of lacing .  the way this tastes is absolutely nothing like the way it smells ... m - full , pleasing mouthfeel . the best part of this beer .

body is significantly darker than i 'd expect out of a typical hefe , but not to the point that this should be called a dunkel ; kind of a thickly hazed tarnished bronze , with weird , grainy chunks of yeast . massively fruity , spicy , and complex . it 's nice to see japanese brewers stepping outside the box a little . sadly most of the other flavors from the nose are very subdued here , though the cidery sweetness remains . drinkability : this is one of those beers that 's more fun to smell than it is to drink , but it 's still pretty good . worth whatever exorbitant price i paid for it in nagasaki , but not as enjoyable as the pils .  the mouthfeel is silky smooth and really rounds the beer out nicely .

the most beautiful foamy head i 've ever seen , and it lasts forever in the duvel glass , sitting atop a gold so intense it almost glows .  they served it properly too - the temperature was perfect ( not co cold ) . pretty close to perfect .

pours with almost an amber tint with a lovely fluffy head , almost like a belgian pour .  the palate is delightfully smooth and creamy . overall , this is an outstanding dipa that is sure to fill anyones hop fix for the evening .
opaque amber-brown pour with a dense , 3-finger white head and tons of lacing .  perfect creamy mouthfeel .

appearance : the brown head that just will not die . halfway through the glass i 'm still looking at a thick 1/4 ince layer of foam . there 's dried up , sticky lacing all over the glass , too . a perfectly dark taste for a dark brew .  light carbonation , rich smooth mouthcoating sensation from the oatmeal .
a : nearly black brown , long lasting tan head .  mouthfeel was awesome . farily prickly carbonation with some slight drying on the finish due to the barrel aging .

appearance - gold honeyed color in a belgian glass . extremely high effervescence yields 3 fingers of foam instantly . the soft bubbled head recedes unevenly to a thin solid cover .  awesome mouthfeel .
essentially , but not quite , black , it has a large tan head , creamy and long-lasting , slowly shrinking to a permanent frothy head with some nice lace .  great mouthfeel .

pours out to a lightly hazy light orange-amber ( not bottle conditioned ) , forming a tall & whipped off-white head with very good retention and lacing .  m : one of the fullest and creamiest dipas i 've ever had .

the smell is close to overwhelming , but exceptionally pleasant nonetheless . oak , vanilla , toffee , caramel , dark chocolate , raisins , bourbon/brandy , and maybe a touch of cinnamon all alternately ( yet congruently ) jump out at you . quite a complex and interesting beer , the drinkablility is hard to judge due to the faux-thin nature of the body .  m-medium carbonation with a great creamy finish d-hmm i actually like this a lot ... .i 'm very confused by the other peoples ' reviews ... the taste is n't too complex but its otherwise a great drink .
this beer pours a beautiful cherry color with a nice one finger cherry red head .  mouthfeel is superb . great level of spice , perfect carbonation , medium body .

the beer i poured into my goblet has a creamy merengue head , and itself is a rich , effervescent amber . almost like a river-worn globe of amber .  a nice chewy , creamy malt backbone makes each sip a pleasure .

the aroma was quite exceptional . never before have i whiffed this nose of smoke in a beer .  unbelievably smooth in mouthfeel - bittersweet chocolate and bitter roasted notes played effortlessly on your tongue .

a - dark brown . reddish when held to a light . nice lacing on the glass .  first sip reveals a smooth silky textured beer with a fairly thick body and gentle rolling carbonation . there is a sticky sweet residue on my lips after each sip and the boozy warmth lingers as well . the booze factor makes this a sipper and it is a little sweet and boozy to drink a full bomber .

30 cl brown bottle poured into a pint glass ( it 's the only glassware i own ) . a : super-thick , rich , creamy , mostly white foamy head . in fact , the head was so thick that this small 300 ml bottle would n't fit into my imperial pint glass without waiting for some of the head to thin out .  great mouthfeel .
it looked very promising , poured thick and black .  mouthfeel was full and rich . this is a very good beer , and quite a unique one .
pours a dark brown black with a large creamy brown head that retains well and laces the glass .  the mouthfeel is perfect . it is full bodied with low carbonation , and oh so smooth .

beautiful looking beer to be sure , dark , dark brown with a very attractive frothy tan head . just looks so good in the glass .  m : thin to medium viscosity , simultaneously wet and creamy on the palate developing into a sublime smoothness , with moderate carbonation that keeps the texture from becoming heavy or lifeless .

poured into a weizen glass . beautiful colors here - shades of deep amber , gold , and a bone white head that leaves all kinds of lacing . decent amount of carbonation bubbles are present as well .  mouthfeel is damn near perfect for an o'fest , i think . impeccable balance .
a very nice looking sample .  some of the best damn mouthfeel you will ever get in a beer too .
poured a strong tight head that calmed down into pretty lacing on the top . very nice deep lively amber color with rising bubbles from the bottom .  the mouthfeel is velvety and thick .

great `` belgian '' lacing & very good head retention smell : sourness & then woody , lactic notes .  feel : low carbonation , medium body that is extremely smooth for so low abv , very nice drying finish .
massive head over clear copper liquid .  excellent in the mouth .

pours an opaque black with a creamy tan head that retains well and laces the glass .  body is n't the first thing you notice , but once the distraction of the sour wears off , you realize this brew is very smooth , neither tacky nor sticky , nor drying . carbonation can be swirled up , and compliments the feel of the sour in your cheeks quite well . all in all , a crazy departure from the normal dfh offerings and dang fine weissen .
poured an opaque ink jet black with a nice khaki head with good lacing .  deliciously smooth . coating the entire mouth with a lasting finish .
pours a translucent medium copper with some awesome bubbling and a thick doughy head .  m= smooth and crisp . feels resinous as well which is great for an ipa . d= super drinkable .

could n't get too aggressive with the pour b/c it has some major head on it . nice gold , perfect clarity , big puffy white head .  the finish lingers for a while , almost spicy with a slight alcohol burn m - pretty ideal for this style i thought .

a : my usual down-the-middle stout pour results in a near-overflow of creamy , frothy , light-brown foam above a midnight-black body . solid retention and some light , fine lacing .  mouthfeel is smooth and creamy , with a lighter body , almost cask like .

i can taste all the spices and pumpkin , but for whatever reason the taste does n't live up to what this brew smells like . it 's a lot weaker tasting than i thought it would be , at least compared to the aroma anyway .  m- full bodied and creamy . very smooth and silky in the mouth . full bodied but not heavy .

above average head retention & lacing s : lemony with white pepper & orange peel t : follows the nose , also some breadyness & candi sugar , apple peels & general spiceyness up front . finishes with apple peel , lemony & herbal hops & a lovely spiceyness & just a bit of grapefruit at the apex mf : medium bodied , lively carbonation , very nice balance superb drinkabilty i could stay on this all night !  mouthfeel is amazing on this one .
a= pours a nice looking hazy golden amber color with a nice cap on top . great looking beer .  mouthfeel is medium bodied and smooth . an excellent feel .

pale golden-amber , brilliantly clear and bright , this is a beautiful beer . two fingers of head settles down to a thin disc that retains very well .  silky , creamy , and perfectly textured , this mouthfeel ca n't be beat .

pours with an outrageously massive head , a dense , simmering mass of eggshell brown rising over the rim of the goblet like a souffle . what a visual feast !  mouthfeel is incredibly smooth and creamy - almost reminded me of a nearly flat ginger ale , with more depth/body .

pours a dark brown with hints of red at the edges , crackling four finger light tan head settles to a finger tall , and remains all the way through , leaves temporary sheets of lacing that fade ( probably due to the abv ) .  m - smooth as silk .

score : 89 appearance : pours a dark red-brown color with plenty of opaque-ish ruby highlights with three fingers of cream-colored head . excellent lacing , and the head really stick around -- if not apparent by the photo ( proprietary ) .  body is full but not heavy and has a great creamy smoothness . almost feels like an oatmeal stout .

poured an opaque brown , as expected from a stout , with thick , pillowy tan head and excellent lacing .  this is so creamy and not too carbonated , its just enough to get both senses of substantial and refreshing . quite thick , not so much as syrup but a few steps under . one please , fills the stomach nicely , not too harsh on the throat or stomach . it has a nice balance between warmth and coolness in the stomach .

a - poured completely ink black . appears thick and viscous . a small amount of light brown head formed and receded quickly .  this beer is on the lighter side of medium-bodied beers and boasts an exceptionally pleasant mouthfeel . carbonation is perfectly balanced , i could n't imagine any improvement here .

smell : wow ... i was n't expecting this at all . incredibly hoppy , honey , almost strawberry jam sticky hop smell . taste : i found it a little too watery at first , which was a dissapointment . another intriguing brew with an awful label from ray mcneil .  body is full but not cloying . exceptional silky velvet mouthfeel that is full-bodied yet providing a smooth viscosity .
yeti pours out like the darkest of used motor oils , thick and smooth with a monstrous billowing head that never goes away .  m : creamy and delicious . everything is dead on here .
in a tulip the beer was near black in color with a light brown head . the head lingered well , and left abundant lace .  excellent for it 's style .
pours with a hefty amount of two finger thick light tan head , and has a clear copper colored body .  smooth grit with comfort .
nothing wrong with the way it looks . clear and golden , great head .  the mouthfeel was very very thick and creamy and not as thin as say a sierra nevada .
huge bubbly head .  amazingly smooth going down ; full bodied with light carbonation .

now that that is out of the way , this is the first time i am reviewing one of there beers a : rich amber color , nice and clear , with a thick foamy white head about half an inch thick that retains well . plenty of carbonation rises from the bottom of the glass as well .  nice touch of bitterness lingers as i contemplate the rich , full mouth feel . nice beer , much more approachable than the expedition .
two fingers of thick creamy head with good retention and plenty of lacing .  mouthfeel : on the heavy side of the medium-bodied scale and creamy smooth .
opaquely dark with a thick , creamy , fluffy mocha-shaded head . a very luxurious beer , whether it 's really a stout or not .  m- full , smooth mouthfeel .

pours a good-looking clear deeply copper colored ale with a tight off white head . very impressive head longevity and sheeting in the glass , this has incredible looks .  moutfeel : probably the best part of this beer is the mouthfeel . thick and sugary , with a ton of creaminess to start . a crisp , drying effect then takes over your throat and palate upon swallowing . then you are left with an alcohol bite that is both satisfying and warming .

smell is quite strong , a pine and citrus scent with a noticeable sweet honey or caramel malt aroma .  s : smells like sweet malt , spices that i ca n't pick out , some red/dark fruits , vanilla t : tastes just like the smell with more vanilla and even bourbon but in a mellow way , like a fruity , sweet , light bourbon..some alcohol flavor too m : very full bodied , almost to the point of creamy d : highly drinkable for the flavor but less so for the alcohol kick

abv 5 % pours a brilliant , perfectly clear , golden color with a fluffy three finger white head . picture perfect of a pils .  very nice feel in the mouth -- rich , thick , tingling bubbles , kind of evaporates on the tongue . medium-heavy body , quite a bit of honey , i get this apple quality .

a deep mahogany appearance with thick lacing on the sides gave this a beautiful appearance . i emailed the location and i guess what makes it unique is its cross between a red ale and a stout .  mouthfeel is full and rich , easy to sip and enjoy . sweetness hinders the drinkability a bit , one bottle at a time is enough for me .

impressive thick , dark brown , almost red head . intimidating looking , with an enormous presence in the glass . fantastic appearance .  mouthfeel is perfect - smooth and velvety without being clingy or cloying .
hopback pours a beautiful cloudy dark copper with an ample beige head .  thick and creamy . everything i look for in an imperial stout . light carbonation .

pours clear , bright amber with a tenacious head ... got ta love those hop oils .  the mouthfeel was phenomenal . to have a cask conditioned beer is such a treat , and i 'm glad my neighborhood bar always has one beer on cask .

nice . t : strong hop taste that might be too overpowering for the malt backbone .  m : the feel is excellent with fine carbonation lending a creaminess that is top-tier and a clean scrubbing finish with the right balance of crispness and aftertaste . d : an fine tripel with classic light fruit flavors mixed artfully with pepper and spice and a top-notch mouthfeel compose a very good brew .

this is apparently a modification of this location 's recent belgian ale , and also has an addition of pineapple . a- red-copper , thick white rocky head lasts very well and leaves some lacing . there is a bit of haze as well .  very nice rich and creamy full body on this one , super smooth on the palate .

poured into my pint glass the beer is dark chocolate brown bordering on black . the dark mocha head bursts to full three fingers and flirts with going over the top edge of my glass . after a brief rest the head fades leaving a small cap and no lace .  m : very soft carbonation and easy on the palate as a good session beer should be .

its been awhile since i went belgian even longer since i had a lambic beer for wich iam not a big fan but i decided on taking a chance on this pretty highly acclaimed on today and iam glad i did.first off what a pour into a tulip glass a a rosey color with a fluffy pink head that settles slowly into a creamy-like mass with globs of lace behind.a whole lot of stuff going on in the nose a little funk and iron to go along with the sour cherry and vanilla just alot to take in , the flavors are just so much rolled into one starts off big and nearly puckering sour but is stopped abruptly by a cedar wood dryness and iron/metallic note.a nice vanilla pod lends itself well as it melds nicely between the two extremes of this beer.this is a doozy and makes me think more about a style that i didnt care for much before but maybe i havent explored it enough , it might be my beer phase i go into exploring the fruit lambic style .  m : so good i ca n't get enough . nice thickness with light carbonation and a good oily texture make this a delightful treat for my mouth .

app- a nice dark brown which looked alot like maple syrup .  in addition , there are hop oils , caramel , some sweetness and perhaps molasses along with a medium body that is oh so smooth and coats the mouth well . delicious and well balanced .
a freind brought this brew over ... a : perfect look for a belgian ale . deep dark ruby color like an iced tea .  bear republic really , really nailed the mouthfeel on this one .
appearance : deep brown , opaque , with medium brown , dense creamy head , significant lacing in rings . very attractive .  the feel is very silky .
pours a hazy reddish-brown color with a very thick and creamy off-white head . really nice lacing and a good cap throughout .  i really this the mouthfeel is perfect on this beer .
a deep , but crystal clear cherry wood red/brown with some creamy tan head . just perfect !  really wonderful . the mouthfeel is the most impressive and outstanding attribute of this beer .
a-amber with sediment and good frothy head . the color an intense head gives this one high scores .  mouthfeel : perfect mouthfeel .
lots to read on the label.. pours a beautiful solid brown , with a tan micro-bubbled head that washes the glass like a wave on every drink .  mouthfeel is thick with smooth and creamy carbonation .

the nose piques my interest in this brew as the aroma is highly reminiscent of a belgian triple with strong esters of alcohol , yeast , and caramelized sugar . entry is muted until the midtaste takes over by blanketing the tongue with a thick coating of honey . my numbers reflect my overall impression of this brew ... nice appearance , great nose , overpowering honey midtaste & finish .  smooth and creamy , very soft carbonation . booze is extremely well hidden .

pours the color of any other well crafted imperial stout , pitch black but with an impressive mocha colored inch of foam on top . the head displayed some excellent retention and a creamy layer of bubbles from the cask treatment .  medium bodied but carbonation is bright and exciting , reminiscent of deschutes ' black butte porter , very refreshing . ca n't say enough about how great the mouthfeel deschutes puts out on some of their beers , red chair fits that bill .
appearance : dark orange-red ( almost a pinkish head ) with a very thick , light tan head .  the mouthfeel is dead-on creamy .

a -- pour a cloudy pale gold color with two fingers of head that recedes fairly quickly but leaves some lacing on the glass s -- smell is spices , banana/clove , light wheat malts .  m : thick and rich , with a nice amount of fine , late-developing carbonation . perfect for such a big beer .

bottle : poured a clear deep back color stout with large light brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing .  it 's definitely thick , but it does n't feel anywhere near as syrupy as it looks . o : this beer has a great appearance and mouthfeel .

the appearance is truly exceptional . rediculously dark . not even allowing for the amber edges that many stouts boast when backlit , this one is impenetrable to light . a gorgeous head that ranges in color between milk and dark chocolate .  m - medium bodied really smooth with perfect carbonation .
clear , dark brown with ruby highlights .  extremely satisfying in this regard .

the head poured out at 1.5 fingers and stays that way forever in a rocky , creamy form that just refuses to recede . gorgeous appearance .  full bodied , heavy on the palate and full of flavor . i love it .
bottle 1347/3700 a- pours a deep rich black with a nice brownish head .  mouthfeel is big full and smooth very rich and easy drinking with a really satisfing warming in the gut .
the color is pitch black . head is large , creamy , and dark tan .  this has been sitting in the cellar for about a year and i am convinced it has the absolute perfect mouthfeel .
deep amber 2 finger head .  m : the mouthfeel is delightful . fairly thick for an ipa , almost creamy with mild carbonation .
smell - pumpkin , nutmeg , cinnamon , malts , brown sugar , spices . smells like liquid pumpkin pie . rather smooth and easy drinking .  perfect carbonation .
this is one great looking brew ... . both big and small bubbles and what appears to be a layer a grease on the head .  ( m ) mouthfeel is perfect for this beer .

this one pours a dark muddy brown that shows some ruby highlights when held to light . the beer is topped by a nice frothy khaki head that lasts and leaves beautiful lacing .  mf - perfect ! soft carb .

a : very cloudy amber with a gorgeous fluffy white head that dissipates slowly . the bottle conditioning is excellent , so a vigorous pour is unnecessary unless you want a glass of foam . excellent brussels lace .  just take a sip and get lost in the nearly overpowering flavor explosion and the creamy tingly mouthfeel of this wondrous scottish ale .
this brew pours with a deep amber body topped by a medium thick head with lots of lacing .  great mouth feel on this one . no hops or bitterness present at first , but bitter in the finish .
looks fantastic . it even pours nice , it looks like it 's going to be stagnant , then a wave of bubbles blows up and produces this fantastic head .  mouthfeel is perfect , my ideal belgian .

poured from a pint can , this beer really looks like it was just pulled from a nito tap . intense creamy head topping a brown , almost black beer .  the mouthfeel is amazing , thick and solid with a lingering savory finish .

a : amazing head on top of a dark yellow body launches up to the top of the glass and hangs out forever , ending its long life in a spiderweb of beauty . glass is soapy all the way down . this beer could not look any more inviting .  silky silky smooth on the mouth , it makes it feel as light bodied but if you take the time to get a feel it 's almost medium . just fantastic . o- this is deffinitely a good saison , the mouthfeel is the highlight .

pours a deep , hazy amber hue , giving rise to a humongous light tan head that fills half the vessel .  feel is really nice as well , lightly creamy and buttery with super calming smoothness and a bit of chewyness with a slightly bread dough drying in the finish .

poured from the 22oz bomber into a belgian duvel glass . appearance- beer pours a clear brown with red hues with a finger thick cap of irish cream foam .  finishes fruitty & spicy mf : huge & well balanced this was bit ponderous , but tasty .

beautiful looking lager in the tall glass . looks just as good as the pilsners in czech or germany .  m - the mouthfeel is fantastic . medium and a little creamy with just the right amount of carbonation .
head clumping is visible and the head retention is well overall . moderate lacing and pretty clear .  m : light and refreshing with a perfect amount of carbonation .

the pour results in a fluffy off-white head ; the ale is a nice golden hue . patchy head retention and good lacing on the glass .  mouthfeel : fantastic . rich without being syrupy . carbonation is just right .

great divide brewing rumble oak aged ipa : as you pour this beer in a glass you will notice a burnished copper color , a luxurious off-white head that laces and lasts to the end , and a subtle but complex aroma .  dark malts , some chocolate , medium to full bodied and very smooth from start to finish .
a beautiful beer at the start . a dark brew with a thick , creamy head that last 3/4 down the glass .  mouthfeel is fine and not heavy .

this beer pours a clear orange with a white , foamy head and smells hoppy and briney with hints of concord grape . personally , i find this beer to be too hoppy ... it would have been very nice without that second , stronger wave of hops .  mouthfeel was real good .

very pretty two-finger head .  very rich flavor of dark malts and smoke , with hints of coffee and chocolate as well . the finish is almost all smoke , much too intense for my liking . ive used this many times in making caribou pot roasts in the crockpot . they even have a recipe on their website , which is delicious . i was informed that this beer has won more medals at the great american beer festival than any other beer , quite an accomplishment .
poured an almost perfect ruby/amber , crystal clear with a big sticky tan head .  m : smooth and medium bodied .

appearance- pours a mildly murky mix of gold , hay , and amber.very mildbubbling , but a great foamy head and good lacing.looks like an ipa , with some belgian flair . mouthfeel- astringent , slightly warming , and very cleansing . a nice belgian interpretation of an ipa .  it is bubbly on the tongue and does leave you dry . it 's smooth , but just kind of basic . it 's a very approachable stout .

& raspberry , great if weird scents going on here ... t : raspberry , plums , figs , & strawberry jam verging om pop tart filling , very weird , plus leafy hops up front .  it is quite nice on the mouthfeel , almost enough to disguise the heavy-handed corn influence .

an inspiring view and almost magical looking . big , sticky off-white head .  mouthfeel was good and very drinkable ; however , it was slightly bitter ... something i was n't expecting this to have considering the malts .

a-dark ruby to light brown with a huge tan head . clear .  the drink is carbonated a little more than average as well . mf- very crisp beer with little or no after taste . one of the smoother beers around .

- this beer had a very exceptional appearance and a weathered pumpkin smell . very inviting beer , although there was something `` left on the field '' as the beer entered my mouth .  mouthfeel is fine . medium bodied with the right amount of carbonation .
what a `` mixed bag '' this beer is ! smoooth and lovely , nice head , good lacing , and a wierd smell and taste .  mouthfeel is medium to full . there 's a nice level of carbonation .
looks great . almost pitch black body with a massive tan head that is both dense and puffy . head retention is excellent and lacing is substantial .  mouthfeel : crisp and refreshing .

a : traditional motor oil black , very viscous looking . really cool dark brown head , darker than most . this goes away quickly leaving a very thin sheet of lace .  it as a quite full mouthfeel similar to a very sweet red wine , almost syrupy . it gives a good warming feeling .

a - very nice lacing left by a frothy white head with strong stamina on top of a copper colored and translucent body . i even witnessed the bartender pouring some head away .  mouthfeel is nice , actually - light bodied , spritzy carbonation .

amazing , both the most unique and best smell i have in a beer in a good long time . taste- a strong and front malt body .  the mouthfeel is good ; slightly thick and very smooth . however , it is a little bubble and will sting the recesses of your mouth .

the aroma is jam packed full of rich bourbon right up front . hints of chocolate and licorice in the background with dark fruits . the pallet has a nice chocolate flavor to it with some vanilla notes . overall a nice treat here .  taste is a very light malt sweetness upfront with a moderately bitter finish of good length and crispness . a pretty uncomplicated beer , good for the style , a good lawnmower beer .
very natural and fresh apple . not a big fan of the coriander .  body is on the full side of medium . moderate carbonation .
bottle - a - 2 finger head w/ great retention , cative carb . and a golden-amber color s/t fruit/spice/funk .  highly carbonated .
superb retention .  mouthfeel : the bottle conditioning makes for a very smooth ride .
smell is of butterscotch and very pleasing . like you are about to have a delicious dessert .  light and creamy mouth feel with obviously knocked down carbonation .

the aroma was simply amazing ! i was champing at the bit to drink this . very sweet smelling . reminiscent of belgian candy sugars and granny smith apples . it was n't unpleasant but i did n't expect this from the aroma . overall , an impressive beer .  good carbonation .
a - very dark murky brown pour , extremely large ( 4-finger ) head . really beautiful .  mouthfeel is very light and well carbonated .
smell : sweet and pungent . horseblanket nose . spicy belgian funk is reminiscent of a gueuze .  m - low carbonation , tiny bubbles , overall feels pretty good .

smell is very in your face . yeast hits you first , with hints of bananas which are definitely prevalent . really nice beer , one that i would love to have again .  mouthfeel is medium , clean with a bitter hop aftertaste .

s- smell is absolutely perfect . sweet , floral tones with a huge aromatic pineyness . t- taste is milder than expected from the ipaesque nose but good none the less .  good , solid creamy feel with enough dryness to get you through .

perfect appearance . really smooth 2 finger ashy cocobutter brown head . dark black balled body that looks beautiful in my snifter .  if there is , then this ska brew is a prime example ... this is the second time i tasted a bottle of this brew . this is an extremely clean tasting brew which is a great quality i enjoy , but where are the hops ? the malt and ( not overwhelming ) bitterness serve as great supporting backbones to what should be a wonderful hoppy aroma and flavor . as it stands , this brew is severely lacking in hop flavor/aroma and comes across as a brew which should be named `` delicate '' rather than `` decadent '' imperial ipa .
s : big pumpkin with plenty of spices . d : not as good as pumpking but still pretty good .  medium bodied and smooth .
pours dark mahogany with a thick tan head .  nice mouthfeel .
pours a glowing hazy golden with a thick creamy head that retains well and laces the glass .  mouthfeel is sticky and sweet with a nice roundness and full character .

well after all the hype i had to give this one a try , pours motor oil black with two finger tan head , smells of alcohol and burnt espresso , tastes the exact same , if i were to roast some espresso beans until they were charred all the way through , then threw them into a blender with ice and vodka , thats exactly how this tasted to me .  m : about the same consistency as the boston lager .
hazy golden orange and white fluffy head with great retention and nice lacing .  mouthfeel : medium-plus body . medium carbonation . some oily viscosity to the mouthfeel .

poured from 22oz bottle into `` balloon '' glass the darkest ebony color in the body with a rocky massive foamy/sticky dark tan colored head .  as is the case in many of the wilder beers out there it 's not as wacky on the palate as it is on the nose . even for a lover of brett and funk this is n't a highly drinkable beer . if the goal was just to see how far they could crank up the volume on the brett funk then they succeeded but if they were looking to brew something that tasted great i 'll have to say they fell a little short .

this is obviously a schwarzbier or brazilian black beer -- not a euro dark lager . anway : nice black color with thick , foamy tan head , fades slow , very nice sticky lace .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied with a velvety texture , and appropriately low carbonation .
a - clear dark , ruby red . head is thick , creamy and immovable .  mouthfeel : light bodied beer . moderate carbonation .
pours vibrant pale gold with lively streams of carbonation sustaining an impressive large white head and leaivng lovely lacing .  the mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation .
gorgeous . big , beautiful , creamy head over a glowing murky golden body .  fairly thick body .

poured worthily into a duvel glass an orange amber with a thick white froth appearing and clinging nicely as a sip smelling of glorious flowery pine , dank indeed , bursts into bitter pine in the front of the mouth before cascading oily bubbles across just enough malt to save the day , without much abv burn , from what is otherwise a seriously bitter villain lacking a bit of nuance .  light body with good carbonation .
aroma reminded me of strawberry shortcake , but more strongly of strawberry syrup from strawberry ice cream topping .  very smooth without being too full bodied .

copious white , sea-foam head is bubbling up and down . really gorgeous . only thing not making it a 5 : wish the color was a bit brighter s_obvious green apple , wet wood , slightly dank t_very tart , green apple , very lively .  taste is thin and adjuncty . mouthfeel is good , thick and creamy .

aroma is full of floral notes and hoppy sweetness . gummy ... lavender ... spicy ... oh so nice ... smooth on the palate ... a smallish touch of burn on the way down the throat . more balanced than i was expecting ... a nice sweetness up front and a good bitter back-end .  m- very little carbonation . very full syrupy body .

pitch black opaque pour with mahogany glints and a nuclear glow of a khaki cap .  for a big mouthfeel , this simply does n't have a flavor to match . very nice mouthfeel , good bite up front , a bit of carbonation in middle that emphasises the rye flavors , and a crisp finish that is actual slightly ruined by the lingers smoked flavor .
s - awesome on my nose well hopped .  there 's moderate carbonation to it as well .
a- a dense golden/honey color . a nice spongy two finger head with great lacing to the end .  boiled pasta water finish . good carbonation . twinge of acid is perfect .

t : hugely ( and distractingly ) sweet . almost medicinal o : a very complex sipper of a beer that i found overly sweet . enjoyed the non-ba version much better .  creamy mouthfeel with moderate carbonation .

pours a beautiful clear golden orange with a plentiful fluffy head and excellent sticky lacing .  it has a very soft mouthfeel , a little like soda to be honest and you can barely notice the alcohol .

smell is the leader of the pack , amazing scent of coffee , cream , smoke . drinkability suffers from the mouthfeel since this is the only non style rating , but i really like this porter .  mouthfeel is medium with good level of carbonation .

the beer was served in a traditional belgium chalice and the color alone really made me stop and admire this beer . it was a light ruby red , very clear and was topped with a creamy pink head .  m : nice and thick d : not something ill try again .

loving the smell ... sweet oats , grain . - wonderful zingy porter ... nice bitter earthy hop.. and a backdrop of sweet oats and chocolate malt ... a very pleasant and drinkable porter .  dark brown/amber body . it is a very smooth and a sweet sipper . some hops , caramel , candy sugar and oak . not much bourbon . i was way excited to try this and actually find it to be rather average .

great aromas of chocolate , caramel , vineous fruit and roasted grain . could have used some more bitterness , but a fairly good beer overall .  medium mouhfeel with some carbonation . smooth and buttery feel . pretty dry finish .

a : forms a nice 1.5 finger frothy head in my sa perfect pint glass with very good retention . it 's a crystal clear beer with varying colors , being auburn orange at the thinner parts and ruby red at the thicker , and a good amount of bubbles floating up from the etch at the bottom . perfect appearance at least .  feels very creamy but that does n't make the beer more drinkable to me .

pours a cloudy yellow with white high lights . the head is astounding . it is enormous and when the dust settles it remains a nice lacing .  mouthfeel : light-bodied but not watery . it had a nice feel to it .

a- pours a splendid black color with a thin milky looking head that lasts the entirety of the beer and copious rings of lacing .  there 's also just a hint of citrus from the orange peel ( or orange oil extract ) the smooth mouthfeel and moderate body is not unlike that of a german hefeweizen .

into a pint glass , it poured a transparent straw/gold ; heavily carbonated , two fingers of bright white , and great head retention and lacing .  this is my first review and hope it looks well , even if not my favorite beer . leaves a malt taste on the roof and tongue . this is the first scottish ale i 've tried . for comparison , i love dark ales , like ommegang abbey belgium ale and founders breakfast stout . bottle serving .

s : bakers chocolate , ripe dark fruit , sour oak barrel , t : roasted chocolate malts with a strong acidity from the bourbon barrel . weird kind of taste .  maybe i could not taste the `` rare '' but this really sucked compared to the 2008 classic gueuze which is a fantastic gueuze .
pours out an opaque black with shimmering brown at the edge of the glass . thick , creamy , off-white head and thick lacing as well .  m - great carbonation , finishes well .
smells very floral , earthy , cedar wood .  m - medium body and low carbonation .
`` the cheeky ale '' pours out a beautiful reddish and slighly brown amber with a tan head .  mouthfeel is crisp , the whole drink is refreshing due to the good carbonation .
smell is superior . a robust but citrusy smell that you get a hint of straight out of the bottle .  pleasantly carbonated on the palate , with a dry finish .

appearance : clear orange in color with a 2 '' head that slowly falls . some mild lacing develops .  being of fan of bocks , i was fully prepared to love this ubiquitous doppelbock . it was kind of sweet and malty , smelled great , felt nice going down -- quite satisfying . there was a slightly funky smell to it , and an even funkier taste . i thought that was more common in highly hopped beers . at $ 10 for the four pack , i hate to try it again for fear of wasting my hard-earned beer money .

mouthfeel- nice carbonation , refreshing drinkability- overall , the taste did n't really live up to the smell and appearance .  m- moderate/high carbonation , medium body , lager clean . crisp enough leaving a refreshing feel .

full and rich , with dried fruits overtaking the nose . lots of vanilla in here , as well as some caramel and licorice . t : quite a lot going on in this brew . nothing too special here . d : so scarily drinkable . at 11.5 % , i feel that i could sip this all night .  medium-full body and medium carbonation with good smoothness .
brilliantly clear light goldenrod , forming a large meringue-like rocky white head with excellent retention and gorgeous lacing .  very creamy and full . very dry .

bottle and served in my expedition snifter ( along side of the 5 & 8 ) : a - very dark with some ruby highlights and the best head of the three with a good creamy lace upon the glassware .  mouthfeel is about right for style , perhaps a touch undercarbed , but all else is acceptable , though it showcases a flavor profile best left behind the curtain .

really good . t : milder than the smell , with a taste of mostly apples and cider , creamy caramel , and a mild woody gin finish .  - well carbonated , dries the mouth a bit . nice smooth body , probably this beers highlight is the mouthfeel .
looks like a magazine beer ad . beautiful clear , light , orange-amber color .  mouthfeel is light with a good spike of carbonation .
330 ml bottle poured into a tulip glass . appearance - the beer pours a hazy golden orange with three fingers of pillowy off-white head .  very light body , and highly carbonated and fuzzy .
appearance : pitch black with a thick foamy lasting head that laces nicely .  it was somewhat thick with some carbonation , and had a hot aftertaste .

smell : lovely aroma of apples , pears , and light citrus - notably grapefruit . slightly sour smell comes in at the end . a very sour character shows up that is a bit cloying , then the beer finishes strong and unpleasantly bitter .  a - opaque black color with a small head that disappears quickly s - rich chocolate-like aroma , mild yeast esters , some smokiness , no hop perceived t - roasted malt flavor dominates , some yeasty esters and mild hop flavors take a secondary role , very gentle mild hop finish with some lingering smokiness m - smooth creamy medium body with moderately low carbonation d - this is a decent enough oatmeal stout . the head and retention is disappointing , but the smell , taste and mouthfeel are acceptable .

pours a pitch black color with a huge brown head into my glass .  the mouthfeel is thick and oily with a mild burn going down . have a bottle of this is all i can handle , which is good because the full bottle would have me a little too buzzed .

golden colored and pours a huge white fluffy head with good retention .  light-medium caramel malt sweetness up front , continued in the middle with a hint of earthy hop bitterness , finishing with a more of the same . medium mouthfeel .

a - nice slightly tan head that could have better retention , but leaves excellent lacing . beer is a deep reddish brown color . looks great .  i 'm not sure what a `` baltic '' porter is supposed to taste like ; but this one is quite different from most porters i 've had . sweet molasses aroma that is greater than any chocolate or mocha that might be found . a strong level of metal present also . sweet , almost like brandy . reminds me far more of a double bock than a porter . i can not detect any hops at all . too sweet for me , making it more one-dimensional without any complexity .
copper color with two fingers of creamy offwhite head that really stands up . leaves nice lacing .  it 's still fairly sturdy though , and carbonation is low but solid .
a : dark amber-orange color , good carbonation . very good sized white head with great head retention . maintained ateast 1/4 '' head throughout .  m : thick , chewy..medium carb .

s - great smelling ! lots of nice fruit and hoppy deliciousness . overall , a fantastic beer . it 's odd that it 's an amber , as it tastes a lot like an ipa .  good mouthfeel for this light body but the hops balance the feel .
a unique looking beer .  mouthfeel : good carbonation , nice medium body .
drinking it on tap though or in a glass , i love the cloudy , orangish look that it has to it .  could be a bit less carbonated .
huge tan head after a normal pour , looks very nice .  m - full bodied and chewy with a moderately dry finish with some alcohol noticeable .

the nose is excellent . chocolate , caramel , dark breads , a little honey and molasses . the nuances from the nose did n't really carry over .  mouthfeel was nice smooth and easy to drink as far as body goes .

excessive packaging ... appearance : pours a thick , gloupy black and then cascades out an amazing amount of dark tan head that haves great retention and is very creamy looking .  m : crisp and clean , moderate levels of carbonation and warmth . medium body .
excited to try this one ... a : looks perfect . deep murky copper color with a thick 1 inch white head that fades decently .  mouthfeel was nice and thick ; you know you 're drinking a dipa .
i was excited at first , as it came to me looking dark and frothy , and the smell was nutty and malty .  m - surprising carbonation fight with a medium bodied beer .

the nose is beautiful . i get the belgian yeastiness , and something akin to peaches served with a dash of allspice . so far it 's awesome .  mouthfeel was good , with plenty of carbonation and a nice smoothness to it .
jet black ... amazing tan head .  a little sticky and a very bitter aftertaste .

this is an impressive looking belgian , from a 355 ml bottle it pours a deep hazy apricot colour with a great deal of carbonation action , and a massive creamy head that gets chunky on the pour , rises above the rim of my chalice glass and holds its form . solid lacing down the side of the glass .  smells of raisins , a hint of semi-sweet choc ? mouthfeel is nice , thick , syrupy & smooth ... the way i want a barleywine .
appearance - crystal clear gold body with a huge white head ( took three goblets to pour this ) . gorgeous .  mouthfeel - medium bodied and smooth with a good carbonation level .
head leaves a serious amount of lace on the glass . really a great looking pint of beer .  pleasantly effervescent mouthfeel .
great retention and great lacing .  mouthfeel is pretty good , goes well with the style of light and highly carbonated .

d : nice big i.p.a. , best smelling i have had yet , very flavorful and the malt has been kept in check and the hops can come right through .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied and carbonation is moderate .

looks really nice s : light fruity smells , with a caramel malt , slight peppery notes from from the hops , maybe a slight metallic note .  the carbonation and mouthfeel were appropriate for this style .
thick brown head with moderate retention . excellent lacing throughout .  thick and smooth mouthfeel .

looks great . large , stark white head with plenty of lacing . it looked great in the glass but fell apart upon tasting .  m & d - this beer is great on its own , too light and carbonated and malty for me , but suits a nice dinner perfectly , goes well with food and that was its intention so i must review it within its intentions and the style , for which it is very good

s : some spice notes in the aroma -- cloves , cinnamon , and nutmeg -- followed by sweet caramel and vanilla aromas . there are some floral notes in there as well as a touch of sweet citrus . t : similar to the aroma , spices come up front but do n't overwhelm .  mouthfeel : nicely carbonated , and nice and creamy . feels good on the tongue .

bourbon colored with an excellent 3 finger head that rises a good 1/4 inch above the glass . very foamy head that last a long , long time .  this beer has noticeable viscosity and a big thick feel . minimal carbonation .

strong aroma of coffee and chocolate . this stout is pure blackness and even thick then disappates to thin dark brown head .  crisp , clean mouthfeel with flavors of dry , pale malt . at first , i found myself wanting more flavor , a la boston lager , but the mouthfeel and resulting drinkability really brought things back up for me in the end .
oustanding pine and cedar aroma . as i drink this , the bitterness taste bud region in my tongue goes haywire .  m : pretty creamy and lightly carbonated . easy to swallow a mouthful .
a : aggressive pour yields 2.5 fingers of pillowy off-white head with very good retention .  m - lighter side of heavy , pretty smooth .
this has one of the best aromas of an ipa that i 've ever had . sticky , piney , resiny aroma . i find this to be a very drinkable ipa .  m : medium in both body and carbonation .

the head very slowly fades to a 1 cm cap atop this impenetrably black brew , leaving beautiful , copious lacing everywhere . perfection in appearance .  light mouthfeel with a good amount of carbonation when you drink it .

the brew itself is a spectacular amber-orange color that is crystal clear . the head dissipates to a constant quarter-finger thickness with excellent lacing all the way down . while it has a fantastic appearance , everything else is only slightly above average ( for microbrews ) .  m : light-bodied , crisp , very clean , refreshing .

22 oz bomber pours copper to orange with a 4 fingers+ offwhite head with effervesence . great lacing & head retention s : fruit & oak-like notes taste : apricot & oakey notes up front .  thick body is very good . it 's just passable for now .

s : smells delicious . tart fruit all over the place . fairly satisfying . m : huge carbonation level makes it just a tad unpleasant , but not so much so that i dont still enjoy the beer overall .  mouthfeel : bitter . nice carbonation .
dissipation takes it 's time but leaves fantastic lacings .  i felt that the mouthfeel was the best part of this brew .
i have to say that the smell of this is fantastic . t : wow , the taste is a bit of surprise .  mouthfeel is good , soft and tingly .

poured from a liter swingtop bottle into a snifter a= pours a thick black color with a nice one finger brown head that lasts suprisingly long with amazing lacing . s= huge hop notes which is amazing as well as a prominent coffee smell .  mouthfeel - nice body , pretty crisp .
a nice wine scent . taste is like it smells , which is good .  it 's very creamy and goes down easy . i 'm really disappointed with this .

this one sure looks like an ipa , pouring a nice copper color with a huge head that leaves nice sheets of sticky lacing on the side of the glass .  mouthfeel was smooth , light , though i do n't know i 'd go as far as crisp .

huge rocky off-white head with good retention . carbonation bubbles rise to the top which makes the head more active than a tornado in a trailor park . fine looking beer !  i like the thick , syrupy mouthfeel as it 's quite comforting but the taste gets old fast and just is n't complex .

the aroma is like a fresh hop cone very nice . from what you expect with the aroma is a slight let down but that said it is nice . the taste malty to start the taste turns to a earthy hop flavor .  medium bodied ; good amount of carbonation .
smells great . taste . a decent iipa .  mouthfeel was really good for a light beer . liked the carbonation , and felt richer than it tasted .
very interesting . smells sweet but different .  the body and carbonation levels are appropriate .

it produced a nice , soapy , white head at about 2-fingers . decent retention that left some seriously clumpy lacing behind . this is a vibrant and inviting looking beer .  the mouthfeel is very nice , it 's very carbonated which works with the ginger presence , and the mouthfeel is at about a medium thickness .

how many citrus fruits are there ? this one has aromas of all of them -- i 'm picking up kumquat , grapefruit , lime and tangerine ( piney rind ) at the very least . all those citrusy hops i smelled are seriously restrained in the taste . from classic to extreme , from belgian to beefy american , from populist to just plain weird , dogfish head 's got it all . i 'd be their bitch in a heartbeat .  mouthfeel is heavier than i 'd anticipate . i wish i liked the flavor of this because its heaviness is spot on .

the beer poured into the glass crystal clear medium maber with an off-white frothy head which lasted to lace the glass .  mouthfeel : light/medium with a tart , crisp finish drinkability : i really do n't crave another of these ; this certainly would n't be a lawnmower beer for me conclusion : just kind of unsorted ( also kind of an odd bitterness on the finish ) ... i tried this a year or two ago and was n't a huge fan ... now that i 'm reviewing it ... i 'm still not .
big ripe banana aroma that is quite pleasing . malts can be noted as well .  mouthfeel : full-bodied with a strong , expressive carbonation .
amazingly attractive .  the body was definitely heavy on this one . heavy for a dipa especially of this size .

smells wonderful . cloves , banana , caramel , fruitiness . nice comfortable warmth from the alcohol . not something i could see drinking a ton of at a sitting , but delightful as a one off .  mouthfeel is of alcohol . the brew itself is medium-heavy bodied , with a very clean finish . this beer is clean as far as mouth feel goes , but is not as forgiving to the throat on the way down .
poured into an imperial pint glass , formed a 1 1/2 '' tan head over the slightly cloudy dark reddish amber brew . frothy head lasts and lasts , with plenty of dwelling lace .  good carbonation .
smells nicely of bourbon , really great smell overall when you put your nose in it .  the mouthfeel is about right for a stout , a bit thick with low carbonation .
