smell of dark rich chocolate , coffee and molassas , having some dark fruity earthiness to it . taste is again rich as in the above aromas with some roastiness and having alchohol present , but not overwhelming .  really thin for an imperial stout .

it pours a pretty orange-amber color , and is crystal clear . a huge two+ finger , pillowy , rocky , bone white , head .  tastes first of caramel , then of grain , and finally thin , fizzy bitterness . for all its color , finishes bone dry with a tragically meager mouthfeel .

flavor did not quite live up to the aroma . it is a bit more piney than the aroma suggests , but still is dominated by citrus . there 's a strange quality right at the beginning of the swallow that i ca n't really describe except that it 's not positive .  mouthfeel is watery . this style needs more body - the maltiness is there , but there is very little roasted character & not enough creaminess .

very inviting . t - a little bitterness as if it had dark chocolate and you can taste the alcohol . a rather large let down after the amazing scent . m - good coating , but the only tingle is in the throat from the alcohol .  maybe a little dusty , but i probably dislike the low carbonation & tackiness more . my tongue feels like i just drank a pot of black tea .

the aroma is absolutely wonderful . absolutely huge brett notes , pungent and funky with a very clear tartness .  the mouthfeel was then utterly unimpressive . overall , the drink looks good but the taste and feel are way too thin and watery .

smell : nice light & refreshing hoppy pine aroma .  very pale straw yellow color , hazy but filtered look no aroma noted water like very light bodied taste and looks like water ... . however better than most would give credit to seeing how its bud .

the smell was sweet , malty , and smokey , which i really liked .  with a near-white head , very little in the way of roasted quality in the nose or taste , and a very thin body , this reminds me of a weak porter with a slight coffee aroma .

the smell has that fruity scent that just says dfh in my mind , must be the local weather . lots of subtle scents here and i am sure i am not picking them all out .  palate scraping astringency . the lack of carbonation particularly makes me wonder if i should have given this more time in the cellar to condition .

the smell is aggressive , and with high standard , quite classic . a vanilla character from the oak treatment adds nicely to the vibrant sweet malty caramel butterscotch toffee brown sugar molasses notes . really nice ! ! the flavor is quite nice as it reflects the nose yet has a surprisingly black licorice thing going on , especially in the really enjoyable aftertaste .  the carbonation and the bitterness overpower the toasty flavors .

s. funky sweet spiced berry nose - lots going on here with a nice play of sweet and spicy battling it out .  the lack of body really disappointed me . while surprisingly drinkable , this beer needs to be heavier to match the taste , so more body and more alcohol are needed .

smell is hops - straight , beautiful hop smell . seriously , smells awesome . okay , taste is lagging behind a ways .  very light bodied , an ok mouthfeel.. just way too watery and thin , not much for taste , just some lemon zest on the after taste .

appearance : darkest , thickest brown head i 've seen , even a notch above rogue 's shakespeare stout . pitch black even when directly on top of a 60w lamp . tall head , intense lacing .  on top of that , the beer tasted a bit flat and felt thin .
s= huge spices like a fruitcake , or maybe like a spiced vanilla tea . the lovely scents simply do n't follow through in the taste .  the feel is fizzy and watery thin .
i love the smell of this stuff , there is n't a better smelling stout in the world , even if its from a can .  as many others have said , i 'm not liking the extra carbonation .

s - i really like the nose on this one a lot . healty dose of peppercorn with some complimentary citrus , something i usually do n't go for . the winner is a great hot chili burn on the backend of the nose from the chili pepper . really excited to try this one .  it is entirely too thin for a stout .
robust cherry smell that is fantastic . taste is almost all cherry , wheaty malt underneath .  mouthfeel was pretty watery and went down quickly .

cranberry nose with traces of brett-like peppery suede funkiness ( either from the kombucha or actual brett ) , black cherry , dried peaches , honey , and cider . it 's one of the most distinct and delicious smelling beers i 've come across in a while . it 's clever enough to inspire analysis , while still being relatively drinkable , in spite of the co2 struggles .  thin to medium mouthfeel with zero carbonation -- lifeless .

this may be the best smelling pilsener i 've ever experienced . lovely complex , floral hop aroma . pleasant light grained malt in the background . overall , a superior beer .  the mouthfeel is quite disappointing due to carbonation that is much too high for a stout and a body which is not thick or creamy .

wow , this smells hoppy . i have never smelled this amount of hops in an ris , i get a lot of really citrusy hops , maybe some toasty chocolate under it , but the hops dominate , wish i could know when this was bottled . it is really interesting though .  smell is not overwealming , but seems sweet with hints of yeast and hop . watery , yeasty , sweet ... more corn than i thought there would be ... taste relatively one-dimensional , unfortunately . fairly drinkable though ... inoffensive and cheap ...
a nice smell . t : malty and roasty .  in body and taste , this is so akin to water that i find it very drinkable .

the aroma is very kinetic - spice , yeast , banana and hops abound . medium-bodied , with a flavor reminiscent of both a belgian and a strong hefe . citrus , spice , hops and bananas all vie for attention . i liked this one substancially more than the 03.03.03 , but i think it would improve a bit with more age .  feel : active , assaulting carbonation and a light , watery body .

a delicious aroma of coffee , and bready malts , and a flavor which delivers with a nice hop bitterness at the finish .  it actually smells more like a belgian dubbel . it does n't have much complexity and it drinks very watery . this is by far the thinnest quad i 've ever come across .

the smell is as excepted sweet and more sweet . hints of flowers and something a bit citrusy . wow ! the taste is sooo much bigger than the smell and really does n't do it justice .  although the mouthfeel is thin for a stout , the flavor is pretty good .
for me , this was one of the most appealing scents i 'd smelled in a long time .  carbonation is too high .

the smell is perfect , like cranberries , very tart and almost bitter . you can really smell this all the way up your nose .  very little mouthfeel , this beer is meant to be drank ice cold as implied with the cold indicator on the can unlike most beers that i drink .

a : a medium amber color with a very robust creamy white head . it has a very creamy and milky head . lacing is incredible . s : it smells of citrus ( orange or grapefruit ) with floral notes .  very thin , and watery . lower carbonation .

very nice . taste & mouthfeel : drier than the aroma suggests .  color very pale green or lemon odor , which suggests more concentrated lemon juice only freshly cut lemon slices , but preserving a small mouth , perhaps a bit too much . the lager that is the basis must be extremely low in taste because the body is still very watery , just a few hints of lemon , no sugar but not bitter unfortunately .
i love how the smell changes over time . got ta give 3f props for the phenomenal smell , tho .  mouthfeel was stingy and watery .

smell was excellent , roasted malt and a distinct vanilla to it .  the mouthfeel on this one fluctuates but it has one of the worst finishes i can recall in a beer . the thin body and soda-like carbonation ( and some wheaty texture ) save this some , but the finish is just harsh . artificial flavor , sticks to the teeth , chewing on cardboard , something is wrong here finish to the mouthfeel .
s : lots of bacterial funk , acid , and dark fruit , very fragrant and pungent .  m : water thin , light side of champagne-like carbonation .

dark roasted malts , espresso , bitter chocolate , vanilla bean , and some black currant . very one dimensional with little complexity . you mainly get a big slap in the face of dark roasted malt , with some bitter chocolate , and coffee in the finish .  its rather thin in the mouth , and doesnt ready leave me wanting more drinkabilty - with its high alcohol , and bitter mocha overload , this beer doesnt do it for me .

the aromas were of blood oranges , honey and moist , fleshy herbs ( ie . basil , bluegrass , cress , sorrel , epazote , etc . ) on the palate these images were joined by flavors of toasted , dry biscuits . it was vermouth-like in its exotic spicing and dreary , liqueurish texture ( blame the poor handling ! ) yet its bracing , raw , and complex extraction of herb overcame even this `` flaw '' . can a great ipa arise by accident ?  feel is thin , dribbly and loose .
absolutely lovely . very inviting .  mouthfeel is painfully carbonated . light bodied , way way to much carbonation .
this beer smells amazing . t : very roasty , lots of coffee , lots of chocolate , some sweetness in the background .  it was very thin bodied as well .

smell has a great malty dark fig aroma . very warm smell . taste is also very malty .  the palate is not unpleasant , with plenty of that molasses , clove , and dried fruit and some decent maltiness , but this beer is very light in body ( hence my unusually low `` mouthfeel '' score - i rarely dock or add points here unless there is significant deviation from stylistic expectations ) .

sweet malts , wheat , maple syrup , and barrel aged booze in the nose . wheat & sweet malts with a hoppy backbone . boozy on the way down , leaving your throat tingly .  very thin feel , little oily .

aroma is very fruit dominated , and not by any single one . peach , lemon , starfruit , lime , mango ... it 's an intoxicating tropical melange . some contrasting oak and fresh yogurt notes are there too , lending some harmonizing 'wild ' elements without getting too funky . flavor is moderately puckering , tart and verging on lemony sour . hop elements are present though indistinct in the mix , lending some possible leafy orange tea notes , and residual bitterness .  m : thin , watery , light-bodied , not something you 'd expect with the smell .
fruity nose classic ipa ( not the barleywine as is sometimes said ) .  the mouthfeel needs work . it is n't creamy at all , it is just really watery and lacking carbonation .

poured from the bottle into a nonic glass a- pours a dark orange amber color with a two finger frothy , slightly fluffy head that leaves some sticky , patching lacing , and high streaming carbonation s- a strong bouquet citrus , pine , and floral hop aroma t- balance of piney and citrus hops , caramel malt backbone , pretty strong woodiness , hits you with hops on the front and finishes with a strong piney hop finish , leaves a bitter aftertaste m- pretty smooth drinking , finishes a little watery o- a good ipa that packs a lot of bitterness and is very aromatic .  it 's low in carbonation and a little thin and watery , which is a real shame .

s- malt . candied sweetness . chocolate with a touch of vanilla .  for some reason i do n't taste the citrus like everyone else does ... m - thin and flat . propagates through the mouth pretty easily though .
body is somewhat lighter expected while pouring , but looks black in the glass s : oak and coffee , come sweet roasted malt . t : slight sweetness .  carbonation is much too high .

it 's an awesome smelling stout !  for a russian imperial this is even for 9.7 incredibly weak and watery it 's the first thing i notice . the mouthfeel on this is not good , it 's even weaker than most american stouts i 've had .
aroma is fantastic , reminiscent of triple sec and cognac . an intriguing failure of a beer .  very light in body with a slick mouthfeel at first that becomes almost slimy .
pours nearly pitch black with a big frothy , creamy mocha colored head . looks similar to a ris . great lace , great retention .  m : watery , very light-bodied , body of a light lager .

delicious smelling ! t- tart , slightly sweet with more ale grains in the taste . decent , but i was expecting more fruits in my mouth .  mouthfeel was light in body and watery in texture with a fizzy carbonation .
it smells great but does n't live up to the smell .  the mouth feel is very thin for a stout this big and has almost no sweetness .
s : molasses ! brown sugar ... dark fruit ... some tanginess noted . t : chocolate ... sweetness from the malt .  fizzy carbonation and no body .

appearance : beautiful hazed orange with honey lemon corners . a huge 3 finger off white crown with loads of retention and lace . the crown is really frothy and gets nice and dense like whipped cream after you let it settle and repour a few times .  very watery . the mouthfeel was thin and watery as well .

the nose is deep bready malt goodness with a hint of brown sugar ... very nice . the taste , however , falls short of the wonderful nose , a crisp light/weak malt with thinnish mouthfeel , semi-sweet with low key hops behind it .  the body is very thin and watery and the carbonation level is medium low which does not compliment this beer at all .

smell : the smell is excellent . the bourbon comes through in the form of vanilla and a touch of oakiness . it is exceptionally tasty and smells fantastic , but i am having a very hard time getting over the mouthfeel .  fizzy ... gross . m- watery , thin , minimal carbonation , and nothing lingering .

5.0 s : lots of oatmeal is apparent . this may be the most oatmeal laden beer i 've had . awesome balance between sweet and roasted flavors . 4.0 t : the taste is just about as good as the nose , but the mouthfeel is too distracting for me to enjoy it .  the body is a bit thin and feels too bubbly .

best before 26.09.05 appearance : awesome . poured with a nice long lasting beige head .  s. nonexistent . m. also nonexistent . just plain and unoffensive . light beer on amber side ? nothing to brag about but goes down like water . above average in it 's class .

s - strong citrus and pine/juniper nose on it . very fragrant making you expect a delicious taste to follow . m - lots of bitter tangy sensation at the back of the tongue following a few sips , but strangely lite and unsatisfying . d - decent drinkability , but not exceptional . it 's a strange beer : starts off great with an impressive hops-laden nose , but then does n't really delivery .  it seemed to have very high carbonation .

raw in your face noble hop aroma . just amazing . poured a tiny bright white head that disappeared when i looked away . the hop flavor does n't approach the strength of the aroma , but that could be a good thing .  i do n't taste any pecan ... m : thin . not to impressive in this dept o : do i love it ?

aroma was very pleasing . deep and rotund hop nose is neither too flowering , too citrusy , and definitely stops shy of being too grassy . really a unique aroma , something that has become kind of rare these last few years .  the sweetness died out in the taste , however , which was flat and slightly watered-down . a weird bitterness gave an unpleasant mouthfeel but still not difficult to drink .
very nice aroma of christmas spices , oak , raisins , old sherry , toffee and treacle .  mouthfeel is too thin for me .

aroma of a quad / stout mix with the figs , plums and spices plus a hint of grape hi-c infused vanilla . full bodied , viscous without being cloying , chewy . the alcohol is amazingly restrained , not even the inherent warmth you 'd expect at this abv level .  mouthfeel is awfully watery , though not completely distasteful .
good strength and good harmony between the components . the nose is awesome , but that 's the only thing that is .  medium bodied , but watery .

smell : the aroma of the beer is full of hoppy promises . oily pine tar resins combine with a citrus and tropical fruits explosions of grapefruit , lemon , mango and pineapple bombard my nose .  still has some things that i 'd consider defects that define budweiser 's trademarks ; it 's got plenty of personality but not enough charm . overall seltzer water vibe , which shoots beer right up your nose like soda pop . do n't pass it up if you 're at the brewery , simply because it 's not too shabby when it 's this fresh .

aroma : lush and full of fruit , beautiful and deliriously deep , slightly spicy , with further fruity develops , cherries and berries , but burnt . juicy hops and rich malt jump out through the nose , a perfect barleywine bouquet .  the mouthfeel is thin , with excessive carbonation that gives it a slight harsh feeling on the tongue .

it 's a very nice smelling beer . the taste is similar to the nose in that it has the cinnamon , nutmeg , sugar , belgian yeast .  ( m ) thin mouthfeel with some bitterness loosely gripping at the tongue , barely holding on .

the smell is very potent . vanilla , cocoa , brown sugar , port wine . rich , sweet vanilla mixed with tart flavor that almost resembles a lambic ( kinda like ommegang 's three philosophers 2 % cherry lambic effects the overall pallet of that beer ) .  the mouthfeel was a bit thin and watery .

not very much in the way of hops , nothing really stands out . i loved the nose , but the taste let me down just a bit .  m : despite its creamy appearance , the head feels thin on the palate . the brew itself is thin and watery , especially as it warms . the carbonation barely registers .

clear golden body wit a 3-plus finger foamy , clumpy white head that never really goes anywhere . big old patches of lacing on the glass . if reviews were based on looks alone , this beer would rate very well .  taste : decidedly like its nose , only more so ; large notes of bittersweet chocolate and espresso rule the roost , here ; not nearly as sweet as you might imagine ; total lack of carbonation left the impression of a somewhat light , thin mouthfeel .

great hop bouquet -- sweet and juicy , with citrus highlights laid over a smooth backbone of stonefruit ( mostly red ; think cherries , plums , grapes ) , and a little oak . i really like the aroma this beer puts out . the body of the beer is a lovely dark amber color that tinges toward straw around the edges of the glass .  mouthfeel was very watery and not smooth in the slightest .

aroma : an amazing , complex aroma which far exceeds any other pils aroma i have smelled . lemony , peppery , summery , yeasty and malty all zipping around my nose . taste : does n't live up to the aroma but is n't bad .  m : very overly carbonated to the point where it was difficult to drink early on , mild acidity , medium-bodied .
this beer was poured unhurriedly into a flute . lots of swirling carbonation and three solid finger s of thick creamy head .  3.0 m thin .
the smell is a heavenly mix of chocolate and raspberrries and malty goodness .  way too carbonated here , which hurts the mouthfeel quite a bit .

very lovely appearance . aroma : roasted malt , oak , dark chocolate , molasses , hints of brown sugar and coffee .  pretty nice . the body is as thin as water . that leads to a very drinkable beer , actually , since it goes down ... well , like water .
smells interesting and fun . the taste is floral and spicey .  feel of almost flat carbonated water .
devastatingly attractive . dried herb in color . brilliant nose . obviously aged and incredibly smooth on the palate but the cellaring destroyed the hop presense .  m- thin highly carbonated .

very strong hop aromas , lots of citrus fruits like orange grape fruit and spice aromas are very present . it has a very thick tan head , its bubbly and last quite a long time , its body is a dark copper/amber color and is very hazy with lots of carbonation ; lots of lacing . its very spicy and really warms up your tongue .  the mouthfeel is very thin .

smells like delicious ginger snaps , cinnamon and some clove . delicious . it has a medium body with a good amount of carbonation . definitely a sipper , but a very good sipper .  the body is light and really deters the taste .

s- it has a nice nutty character absent form most stouts i 've had . hazelnut and almonds combine with a bit of roasted malt and some coffee to make a nice aroma .  the herbal hops will become medicinal with traces of alluminum and will become a bit less appealing as it goes from a zippy feel to rather stagnent . a flat and bitter hop flavor is the finish .

s - wow , what a blast of aromas : floral notes , pine and citrus smack you in the face . t - it tasted of spicy , piney hops with a sweet , burnt toast maltiness . it is extremely hoppy and fairly easy drinking considering the high abv .  the presence of tannin explains how , while quite watery , satan red is also quite drying .

smell is great , very complex . ripe fruits , some yeast , a tiny bit of roasty malt and a bit of alcohol .  the finish is lightly sweet rather than crisp , and the mouthfeel , which started out thin , ends on a watery , undercarbonated note . zywiec is an average epl , making it a below average beer in general .
aroma : sublime ! super sweet , rich dark ripe fruits coupled with notes of chocolate . an all organic ale , not the best dubbel , but respectable .  thin and watery .

smelled fantastic ! citrus fruits dominate - grapefruit , lemon , orange . taste was disappointing after the wonderful smell . the smell was very sweet , but it tasted bitter and sour . actually , the taste is pretty appropriate , since it tasted like unripened fruit . this is the the first of the vertical epics i 've tried and i was n't very impressed .  alcohol is very well masked for a 6.5 % way too much carbonation for my liking .
it 's robust enough that i 'd call it damn good . taste is good .  the mouthfeel is pretty thin and watery .

a special cask tapped last night at the j. clyde . s : an absolute explosion of floral and citrus hop aromas -- it smelled dipa-esque . a rich crackery malt backbone is evident , as well . a solid offering , and if gpbc decided to make the aroma of this beer into a car air freshener , i 'd be all over that .  mouthfeel was light in body and watery in texture with a flat carbonation .

s : mmmmm ! banana , caramel , chocolate , pecan . twinge is a big negative . better as it warms , but not great . looked and smelled great but flavor was not smooth and a little imbalanced .  i thought that the mouthfeel was kind of watered down ... it needed more `` oommff '' .

big grapefruit aroma . good head . high 75 ibu .  mouthfeel sucks . the viscosity is where it should be , which is the only reason this gets anything above a 1 for mouthfeel . low carbonation is acceptable in a beer like this , but no carbonation is inexcusable . drinkability is ok , but the alcohol heat definitely shows up , and the poor mouthfeel does not help either . alot of promise in this one though , would be quite tasty if it was carbonated , and not quite so hot .

awesome grapefruit smell with bitter peel , and some grassy notes . however , this seemed like a head-fake , because the taste revealed less citrus and more apple/maltiness , and a very thin abrupt finish , that was n't as bitter as the nose suggested either . in fact , a very thin-bodied beer overall , in spite of the decent carbonation .  flavor : then , i drank some & everything went downhill . it was watery & disappointing .

( served in a tulip glass ) a- this beer has a dark opaque brown body with a mousey thick creamy head that last and lat . s- this beer has a very clean smell with a faint hint of dark roasted malt or prunes and as it warms quite a bit the notes of brown sugar and alcohol come through .  tastes like someone put artificial flavoring in carbonated water .
motor oil black with a head like you would see on a rootbeer float .  the flavor was spicy and malty and the mouthfeel was tingly along with a burning sensation as it is swallowed .

very aromatic . t : consistently bitter from start to finish , but not overwhelmingly so . i love the scent and the hop flavors , and i can see why this beer is very appealing to others ... but it 's just not my thing .  mouthfeel was very light bodied and again , watery .

aroma : smell is incredible natural smelling apricot tones this one smells very nice , i am impressed not overly cloying and no off tones to boot . very natural smells like apricot juice , good stuff .  m- this is precisely the opposite mouthfeel that i want . it feels like it wants to be sweet and sticky , but it really just falls watery on the tongue .

the aroma begins with alcohol , followed by raisins and prunes , browning apples , black cherries , belgian funk . the mouthfeel is spritzy and explosive on the tongue with a medium-dense body and long semi-dry finish . as a matter of fact , the entire finish is tobacco . somewhat oxidized , dank and musty .  overall feel was very thin , not impressive and not terribly satisfying .
it has a pleasantly pungent , complex smell . all sorts of flower and herbal along with some mint .  body is pretty watery .
a nice complex aroma ! the beer smells pretty good , but there a more pungent stouts out there .  m - crisp start but the finish ends up being very watery .

big foamy head , a mix of burnt malt and thick coconut in the aroma & # 8230 ; very aromatic . nice clash of burnt malt that strays to slightly to the acidic side and the mild sweetness of the toasted coconut . very interesting and yet another beer i wish i had with dessert though this would have been better with the sweet potato pie .  taste is that of a standard belgian wit , but the body was off-puttingly thin . it was watered down , far too light for my tastes of wit beers .

first of all this is an amazing looking beer . a nice pale orange , hazy , with a huge rocky white head . great retention and that belgian lace that i love .  no attempt whatsoever to hide the alcohol and the addition of the heavy acidic espresso taste and a watery mouthfeel make this hard to down .
short 's nailed this one . spicy tomatoes , peppercorns , alcohol , tabasco , peppers .  empty , chalky mouthfeel , not much going on here .

the aroma is amazing , i must admit . the feel is definitely most disappointing . this thing smells amazing , and tastes good too , but the feel is a bit rough around the edges , and adds some unfortunate difficulty to the drink-ability .  good lacing down the glass s : coffee , sweet bready malts t : coffee , slight harsh maltiness also slight hint of chocolate m : light very thin bodied beer .

the nose has a nice strong hoppy and fruity-peachlike aroma .  better than expected , but as someone who despises ab products + light beer i was n't expecting much trouble is , within the same can it tasted like lemonade in some sips , water in others . giving it a 4 on drinkability because it 's light , so one could drink a lot of these if they chose to .

s : abundant floral hops , definately some cascade . the perfect combination of floral , bittering , aroma , in a showcasing of hops that is presented beautifully , well balanced and tame but not lame .  the palate is way too thin for a stout .

d - the aroma is very nice , but the flavor just does n't live up to it ( an unfortunate trend i have noticed with dieu du ciel ) .  2.5 m thin , with only the grain tastes and the slightest stickiness keeping it from being water itself .

probably one of the more amazing lager aromas , it 's truly crisp and fresh , i could smell it all day . the flavours are light , but the aromas quite amazing . indeed overall this beer is much better than even most european lagers .  this is a drinkable brew that definatly packs a punch , but it 's kind of one dimensional and thin .

aroma was ridiculously appealing - sweet malt , caramel , maple , vanilla , oak , some dark fruit , and alcohol . wow . d - this was a sipper , but drinkability benefited from the fact that it tasted so damn good .  the mouthfeel is confusing as it feels too thin for the amount of sweetness on the taste buds .
if you are going to have a flavored beer , apricot is a good one . it 's all about the smell and the flavor . apricots and other fruits .  the mouthfeel is astringent .
s - delicious blueberry scent which overpowers just about everything else .  skimpy in body , vapidly dextrinous and approaching watery in mouthfeel .

a - hazy yellow , highly carbonated , soda pop head that dissipates quickly s - yep , definitely a peach beer , but pleasant .  appearance : golden with extremely high head with low head retention smell : sublte hop aroma , taste : light and refreshing , herbal with some decent hop flavor mouthfeel : light bodied , way too much carbonation , jeez ... drinkability : great flavor belgian pale but its overcarbonated .

the aroma is chock full of coffee ! some chocolate , a very sweet , near kahlua like scent !  m - too thinned out , would guess this is medium bodied but seems like they cut this one with a little bit of water or something .

the mystery beer in my joe 's garage variety pack , poured a deep brown with dark near crimson hue when held up to the light with a large 2 finger mocha colored head.perfect 5 for me aroma wise its american big on the fruity , piney hop mixed with chocolate and earth just fantastic love the big hop profile.the same goes for the flavors big piney drier hop profile intertwined with bitter chocolate with a earthy raw nut lingering finish.a little prickly on the mouth but nothing to take away from the great flavors of the beer , damn i wish there more porters like this it is the most hoppedup version i think i have had to date .  seemed flat and had a flat taste .

summer : clear gold in color with a huge , meringue like white head that really hangs around for a while . winter : dark copper pour with a big , lasting , frothy , off-white head and good lacing .  m - way too much carbonation for my taste .

s : coffee ice cream cones ? like a joy ice cream cone , and a mild coffee . only beer yet to give me that . m : creamy , creamy and creamy . imperial anyone ? t : i 'll start with a heavy dark chocolate to start .  m - light bodied , very thin feeling , and very little carbonation o - not too impressed with this beer .

smell- huge pine , bitter citrus , terpentine ? love it ! big aromas have me very excited about this beer . taste- the pine needle flavor instantly greets me , along with a nice bittersweet malt finish . there is a lot going on here , and i can taste a duality of hops types playing here .  mouthfeel is indeed excessively thin , leaving a slight tingle of carbonation , but otherwise going down like iced water .
this a big funky nose ! t : i was excited to try this , but i find myself feeling a bit let down .  the mouthfeel was flat and very dissapointing .

s : this beer smells incredible . huge vanilla aroma that is mixed with a huge coffee aroma .  taste is rich and sweet , slightly nutty , but this beer really sufferes from it 's thin and watery mouthfeel .

a - clear red orange body with two finger for frothy tan head and excellent lacing s - a little pine and a little citrus .  chocolately , dark . dry chalky taste , sweet . some warming . watery porter-like .

smells slightly woody followed by ripe fruit , but relatively lean . this beer has a great aroma , and a few promising notes , but overall disappoints .  mf- watery and too light bodied for a red ale . mouthfeel lacking .

poured from a bottle into a pint - exceptionally clear , copper colored with a one finger head that was almost latte colored , enough carbonation to keep plenty of lacing and a little bit of a head until the end .  m - flat , uninteresting , a little oily .
smell is excellent and unique . predominate smell i get is apricot .  m - extremely carbonated .

poured a nice golden color with a dense rocky head pronounced piney and citrusy aroma , along with an earthy spice to it . huge hop bouquet . this beer seemed a little thin and light bodied for an ipa .  the mouthfeel was flat leaving a watery feel in the mouth .

it reminds me a bit of some barley whines . quite complex . taste : sweet apple , honey , strong grain , plenty of oak in there , dark fruits and alcohol .  far too thin and light for a bock . carbonation was assertive , but the body just felt thin and watery .

pours bright orange , with a nice soapy head incredible hop aroma , tangerine , grapefruit , malt biscuit and some caramel sweet upfront with a bitter pine , citrus hop bite and a hint of booze very creamy , delicious and pretty well balanced for a double ipa overall it was a very enjoyable beer .  starts with fruit taste , looses interest with a thin mouthfeel and water middle although helped by a supporting co2 texture and some tartness ( carbondated water ) ending with lactic acid and dry pucker on the back of the tongue and esophagus .

s - beautiful wet hopped aroma with a citrusy and piney profile that is extremely fresh . there 's also a bit of bread and caramel malt present .  flavor is of arange , and body is highly carbonated . prickly mouthfeel , and a bit boring overall
d - this is pretty good ipa .  too thin .

this big california ipa packs a heavy alcoholic punch at 8.5 % abv , but for such a great smell , i was let down with the taste . do n't get me wrong , its good , but it is not the best for this style .  md - thin and not much of a body to it .

a : hazy yellow with a frothy head that has great retention ; what a hefeweiss should look like s : grainy with the typical banana and cloves poking through the hay/earthy/straw graininess t : a nice balance of earthy grainy yeastiness and banana and cloves ; subtle spice nodes ; a tiny bit thin on the way down f : pretty good mouth feel but a tad thin at back end d : wonderful drinkability ; the quintessential hefeweiss beer ; great especially for a hot humid day .  biggest disappointment was the mouthfeel which lacked any crispness/carbonation at all ; practically flat and way too light .

poured from a growler into my new holland high gravity series glass a - black as can be with a small circle of tan/brown head s - tootsie rolls with a hint of hersheys chocolate . is this really a beer ? t - tootsie rolls with a hint of hersheys chocolate ... seriously though a little more going on in the flavor however .  smell- sweet malt and grains ( sunflower seeds and barley ) taste- watery with a touch of malt acidic hops . mouthfeel- acidic and bitter .

flavour is bit more restrained , still very nice with all the traditional hefe characteristics , wheaty and yeasty with cloves but also some caramel and brown bread . aftertaste is , like with most wheat beers , very moderate but nice . can you expect a hefeweizen to be much better than this ?  high carbonation and a continental hop aroma mixed with corn . light , watery body with a vegtable-grainy taste . dry , crisp finish . strictly unsatisfying .

a complex , sweet smell with notes of chocolate , honey , bananas and a slight spicy note hiding beneath .  fairly watery on the tongue . i was exited for this one after smelling , but the lack complexity on the palate coupled with the watery mouthfeel made this one a disappointment .

bronze coloured with a big head and marvellous slightly citrus , very herbal nose . hops dominated with a very distinctive lemon rind flavour to the fore .  high gravity beer , this one is king . drink alot of water when drinking or a major headache occurs . so drink with caution .

the aromas are very fine and intense i was very impressed ! !  a thin mouthfeel . extremely drinkable . but that 's all i can really say good about it , the taste is n't great , and the mouthfeel is too thin .

one of the best smelling beers i 've ever tried . good amount of pumpkin . clean and delicious . lighter side of medium in body . not sure if this is a drastic improvement from regular pumking , but this is surely tasty .  m - weak and thin . lifeless .
smells great . taste : pretty disappointing after the aroma .  mouthfeel : pretty thin , with sharp carbonation and a watery finish .

this beer smells incredible . a strong aroma of hops and malts immediately made itself known as soon as the bottle was cracked . excellent lacing .  crisp to the point of being overdone , loads and loads of soda like carbonation . notes : ho hum , average , run of the mill , mediocre ... etc .

sampled @ strong ale fest san diego the beer pours the color of onyx with the head creamy light chocolate brown and portly in size with the resultant lace a fine curtain to conceal the glass .  it tastes ok. kind of watered down . cant taste any malt or hops . it was too bubbly , seemed over-carbonated .
s : crisp aroma with strong malt presence and hints of flowery hoppiness .  m- thin and watery this could be improved greatly , but then it would probably be too sweet .

immense aromas hit the nose . plums and lilacs begin the assault , followed by maple and vanilla syrup and a touch of smokiness . this is a very complex ale , as most dfhs are , but the complexities do n't mask the big abv as well as their 120 minute ipa , imho .  mouthcoating is chewy , tacky and fairly unpleasant . the mouthfeel was distracting but it does become a bit more tolerable and almost smooth once the mouthcoating becomes entrenched .

very unique . i could tell from smelling it that it was going to be sour , but had no idea the extent of sourness .  m : medium bodied beer but it is a bit light on carbonation . feels dull and flat .

a very strong and pleasant aroma . tastes light honey sweetness and clove up front with perhaps a bit of orange zest fading to bready malts with trace hop bitter finish .  mouthfeel feels thin and weak ; this is my only real complaint with this beer .
it is overpoweringly fruity and has an amazing aroma . it pours a cloudy light rose pink with a huge head.you are overwhelmed by the raspberry nose .  mouthfeel is very thin , again very soda like .

s ) pumpkin pie ... this really has it covered . this is spiced , but not over the top , which made me very happy . a very nice balance of pumpkin and beer . this is quite smooth . nice finish and aftertaste . o ) i have n't really had many pumpkin beers , but i 've heard good things about this one , so i finally gave it a shot . i 'm really glad i did .  one thing about this beer is it feels extremely watery .
aroma is piney and citrusy hops .  the body is kind of thin , and there 's too much carbonation , which brings the drinkability down a fair bit .
poured from the bottle into a pint glass a - pours a brilliant off-white three finger head with great retention . leaves gorgeous lacing .  the mouthfeel leans toward the thin and watery side .

smells good . biscuits , the ginger is noticable in the aroma , tea leafs and toffee .  i 'm no fan of bud , and probably have n't had a bmc beer in 2 years , but this is not one of the worst 50 beers in the world . it 's far better than many of the cheap , crappy pale lagers in many parts of the world . although it had little taste to speak of , it was exceedingly easy to drink , which , for bmc swill , ai n't that terrible .
aroma is powerfully sour and very champagney . this is a very good beer , and quite a unique one .  mouthfeel - one of the most water beers i 've had .

nose : a pleasant light piny hop aroma . a very inoffensive ipa .  definative lack of carbonation , maybe this one blew it 's top at one time or another . body wise to thin to stand on its own without more carbonation , lacking in complexity .
the smell was full of bourbon , as expected , that blended well with the fruity aromas expected from a tripel , along with spiced notes .  slightly watery body and bland carbonation .
s- very strong smell . could smell it without even putting nose up to it ! some fruitiness , sweet like a candy store .  mouthfeel is very thin and overly carbonated .
smell : really great smelling chocolate aromas .  mouthfeel very flat for a belgian dubbel .

lots of sour funk upon popping the cork . great sour funkiness with sour apples and pears . also get some very floral notes as well .  taste : carbonated water , with hops and light malt thrown in . mouthfeel : light and quickly fading .

aroma is very enticing-sweet caramel malts and fresh bread dough dominating along with some flowery and piney notes .  the mouthfeel is unbalanced as if the carbonation and the liquid will not merge . for as much noise the carbonation made on opening the bottle , it seems quite on the palate .
s : pumpkin exactly as it would smell in fresh baking . a nice blend of cinnamon and spice present .  m - light bodied and bordering on watery . a little too carbonated imo .
very sweet , but extremely complex . awesome . taste is intense sourness and bitterness , which tapers off to not much else .  a : it 's still carbonated , that 's something at least . too fizzy .

wonderful aroma . warm and oaky , molasses . almost get a bbq sauce scent , very spicey like a worcester sauce . very interesting tastes in this one , unusual .  heard great things about this , found it in buffalo bought a 96 vintage.started promising i liked the color and the nice head , after that all downhill.had little to no smell , the taste was peppery ( overpoweringly so ) and way to sour ! the beer was way to thin and watery to go along with that taste.didnt finish the bottle just to peppery and thin for me , waiste of six bucks .

the beer is certainly lighter than i expected with an almost straw color . the nose on this brew is phenomenal ! i 'm immediately transported to magical grapefruit land as the beer screams citrus into my nostrils . there is a piney base note to this smell to that compliments the soaring citrus very well . not on hops of course , as the grapefruity citrus notes yielded to a piney bite on the finish , but rather the malt character . while still a world class ipa , i felt that the backbone of this brew just was n't quite as strong as i would have liked and the huge hop profile was almost overwhelming .  tingly , thin watery feel .

the smell was excellent . i happen to love maple ( though i confess it is n't something i usually have in my beer ) , and the rich malty aroma of nutty maple notes was divine . ah , well this is a toughie for me because i 'm sure that this is the perfect beer for my girlfriends who are n't so crazy about things that resemble hops , barley , malt ... or hmmm.. beer .  m : very thin and watery -- it has a consistency not far from kool-aid .

well , not quite , but it is a very nice , very complex blend of sweet malts and almost floral scents . it 's a very subdued sweetness , heavy for a lager but no where near as complex as its smell would lead to expect .  the mouthfeel lacks more . and flat .

overall , a seemingly pleasant ipa , that tastes wonderful at first , but then bites back too hard and dies flowery . still pleasant on the nose and eyes and foretaste though .  sweet crackery finish , m - thin with very low carbonation .

one of the finest smelling beers i 've ever come across . very inviting . tasted much along the lines as the aroma , with the hops perhaps just a bit more apparent . quite pleasing . mouthfeel was good , with a medium body which went down nicely .  not so much the taste as it had a good belgian style wheatiness to it but the body was extremely thin and almost watery . i was looking for more in the way of the mouthfeel .

s : smell of yeast and coriander that gives way to banana . t : taste not as complex as the smell , but still pleasing .  body is a nip thin . a bit too still , but more carbonation would have blasted through the empty body of the beer , making it even less desirable .

ahh , the smell makes up for the poor visual aspect ... it is phenomenal ! nonetheless , this is an outstanding nose . barrel aging is very evident upon tasting , as is the alcohol . to me , it almost seems like a tripel and a half , as it needs a bit more body-adding malts and the alcohol is a bit rough ... but that is being a bit picky , i am very glad i brought this out for my 500th .  mouthfeel : way too big-bodied , way too carbonated , and way too uneven .

) this ipa is a hazy , tarnished gold with a light frothy head and excellent lacing .  feels thin and watery on the tongue with a low level of carbonation . bitterness is harsh and detracts from drinkability , mouthfeel is unsatisfying , and the flavors are n't interesting and complex enough to yield repeated enjoyment .
s- smells of coffee , hint of chocolate , a little sweet . enticing .  a little thin overall . mouthfeel : light-bodied and lacking . way too light and delicate of a beer to have an abv of 7.5 % .

n : cherry , honey , fig , banana , candy sugar , light funk , hints of cinnamon and perhaps some clove . o : nicely balanced and easy drinking . this makes a wonderful winter treat !  i must say this beer is best on tap as everywhere i 've tried it otherwise all of its carbonation seems to be non-existant .

s - the first thing that hits you is a bourbon alcohol smell , which is quite potent . the aromas are incredibly complex , i 've never smelt anything like it . it is incredibly sweet , it makes your teeth ache just at the thought of it ; maybe this will lessen with cellaring .  the mouthfeel is way thin , but drinkability is ok .

s : absolutely heavenly . fresh herbal hops , minty even , along with grassy and citric hops as well . m : full , with an excellent long finish , but not overbearing . it 's wonderful . the smell will hook you and the taste will not disappoint . the brilliant combination of hops had me wishing it would never end , and even at a relatively high abv , it remains highly drinkable .  the body was disappointingly thin for such a big beer , allowing the unwelcome alcohol notes to really come through .

things are looking good , very good t : a little bland at the front but it builds slowly with some nice coffee and chocolate flavors .  thin mouthfeel with average macro carbonation . touch of caustic mouthfeel in the middle with the bitterness and petrol notes .

it smells like a a big pile of hops . there are also some alcohol esters and actually a decent aroma of biscuit-like malt . t : hops dominate .  m - kind of flat on the palate with very little carbonation . hop profile caught me off guard and the mouthfeel is pretty weak .

nose is floral , with a heavy dose of grapefruit , and a good supply of light , fresh hops . smells delicious . flavor gets a lot more of the floral character , with a mouthful of aromatic and pungent fern , blended with a good dose of hops , and the citrus is barely shining through , mostly overpowered . this is a decent beer , but the smell definitely had me hoping for more .  it 's drinkable , but the body and carbonation are really lacking .

smells great . big , overripe tropical fruit and citrus with a little bit of grass underneath . i actually coughed and spilled some while pouring and thought , `` man , that smells awesome ! '' while cleaning it up . still good , just a letdown after the nose .  m- not a lot of carbonation , kind of syrupy actually . i feel if it would have been carbonated more it would have helped a lot .

the nose is fantastic , being all floral spicy hop . the flavour is terrific too , delivering a spicy , sappy , resiny , sticky malt and hop elixir .  i recently bought a bottle and had it at home and was supprised to find that it really was not much better than the average super brewery light beer . the taste is almost nonexistant and unlike some mega beers has almost no aftertaste at all which for this beer is actually a benefit . i would compare is most to a pbr .
aroma is wow ! bacon .  m : mild , almost weak or watery . does not have stout presence at all ; feels like flat cola , if anything .

2010 bottle had a ton of suspended sediment in a burnt orange body . wow , aroma is the big winner here . pumpkin pie with crust as it warms ; some clove came thru as well , and even somewhat herbal . pretty authentic pumpkin flavor - vegetable/squash quality , and good amount of spices , incl cinnamon , nutmeg , and clove - but not overpowering . decent volume of malty sweetness / richness ... touch of campfire as it warms . outstanding drinkability - this is the most aromatic and flavorful pumpkin ale you can buy at this level of abv .  the mouthfeel was watery , the body medium/light and the carbonation average .

the smell is surprising sweet with peaches and apricots on top of the big citrus hop base . this is an interesting dipa though i wish the flavor measured up to the unique aroma . still worth trying .  mouthfeel was thin and tingly , and the initial flavor was sour fruit , which was fine , but then it too was quickly overtaken by the taste of grains .

s : big coffee and big chocolate with hints of ripe fruit , plums and molassas , very inviting . t/mf : sort of disapointed with this one , maybe it was because i picked it up at world market and who knows how long that thing had been sitting around getting light struck ( even though i picked it out from the back of the display , but who knows what goes on there ) .  mouthfeel : seltzer drinkability : would be good but the mouthfeel sucks .

aroma is great . i really get a spicy sage aroma on this one . a sweetness from the herbal notes really plays perfect with this one . really a perfect nose . taste is spot on too .  the mouthfeel is flat , but predictable as there are virtually no bubbles in the glass after the first minute or so . as far as drinkability goes , i 'd save it for the hot summer days , the ballpark and the cheap 30 pack for the party .

the smell is amazing -- like a nice plate of blueberries .  mostly smells and tastes like a lager pretending to be an ale . that hint of lager ( as in yuengling lager ) sits there in the background , but then there 's a nice hit of hops in there too . it 's odd , but not necessarily bad ( although certainly not a good american pale in any sense of the word ... it 's a cheap beer masquerading as an american pale ) . not great , but one to try if you 're tired of lager as your cheap beer for the minute .

sour raspberries + classic cantillon funk = awesome . i love it . t : raspberry essence jumps into my palate and my nose as i raise the glass , and as soon as the beer hits my tongue the fruit gets displaced by intense sourness + moderate cantillon funk . delightful . o : i expect every cantillon i drink to be amazing , but based on other reviews i really was n't hoping for anything special from the framboise .  thin on the mouthfeel and the carbonation is way too high on this one making the thinnes hard to handle .
very pleasant aroma . i may have picked up some caramel in the flavor as well as some sharp citrus aspects and some sweetness .  mouthfeel is rather thin for a scotch ale .

pours from 21 oz bottle to pint glass , a deep , dark , caramel-color with a straw colored two-finger head that seems to grow with time rather than dissipate . frothy lace definitely persists .  m : dammit , i hate porters like this . light , watery body , slightly oily , and slick on the palate . this would have been so much better with more body to it .

s : wow , this beer smells amazing . whiskey and bourbon dominate the nose . i could literally sit here and smell this beer for the 15 minutes and be perfectly happy .  the body was very thin and the beer lacked substance .

the nose is bursting with scents of fresh-squeezed oranges , pineapple , guava . good full-bodied ipa with plenty of carbonation zip . i expected more of a fruity-tasting ipa , but this one is herbal , earthy , and spicy .  strong roasted malt character with a twang of hop bitterness , but really light and pale in the mouth with a watery body . no creamy mouthfeel , which was somewhat disappointing , but it was overall enjoyable . clean , pure and watery finish was n't quite what i had hoped for , as i was expecting something a little more milky/creamy/smooth .

very resilient aromatics , wonderful . taste - a brief sweet malt start goes nowhere before some serious hops kick in .  pours a clear golden copper hue which leaves a creamy fast vanishing two finger head and creamy lacing , the smell is herbal grassy hops and some honey malts thats it , the mouthfeel is light and watery and has tastes of honey malts , herbal grassy hops , fresh cut grass , pale malts and finished with a mix of herbal grassiness and toffee and overall i definately would not buy again and the bitterness is only very light avoid cheers .

the nose is extremely complex -- clay soil , caramel , butter , farmland , and fresh aromatic hops are all in there , along with some more elusive intangibles that are conjuring up all sorts of images of rural europe for me . on the tongue , the caramel sings out with a spritzy edge , the hops keep it interesting , and the butter moves to the forefront , but what really does it for me is a slight sour twist towards the end -- reminiscent of those flemish ales that ive recently fallen in love with ( such as duchesse de bourgogne ) . this says to me , `` drink with food !  for the level of alcohol , there is hardly any hotness at all and a bizarrely watery and light body for a barleywine . could also stand some more hops , as i could hardly detect any at all .

aromas of pine , citrus , floral , and just all around nice and hoppy . tastes a little bit of a let down compared to that nice aroma .  m - thin , watery body , moderate carbonation , slight bitterness in the finish .
the smell is very nice . lots of tropical fruit flavor on this one and sweet candy .  m - watery , light carbonation .
s : i thought i died and went to heaven the first time i smelled this beer . caramel and toffee aromas dominate with some hints of berries .  the mouthfeel is surprisingly flat .

smell- figs ! drinkability- deciptively drinkable , i could finish up this bottle in a hurry and then find out that it 's 10 % abv afterward . nice .  that being said i want to keep track of beers i have tried and will start to try reviewing beers i drink ) from a sampler pack found at specs liquor . tastes flat to me . no alcohol taste that i can tell of and not a whole lot of flavor . goes down easy and not much of an aftertaste .

hoppy scent is medium to intense , with a nice mix of fresh citrus and toasted , darker hop bitters . malt figures its way in to create a staggeringly intense aroma for an irish red .  mouthfeel is thin .

black color with a solid brown head . head does n't retain for very long , but wonderful lacing follows this brew from start to finish .  thin , harsh , and astringent- the mouthfeel is where the beer suffers the most .

the smell was slightly chocolate . 2007 bottle 02/23/2008 beautiful smell like gourmet chocolates , an amazing improvement over the last year . this beer is a really good example of a cellar-worthy beer . 2006 vintage 01/10/09 smells malty grains , some chocolate , tastes good and probably ca n't get much better .  it has a below average mouthfeel - boring , too watery and macro-brewish .

it really reminds me of the nose i get off a really good heffeweizen ( spelling might be wrong , but there ya go ) . it 's a bright and inviting smell and makes my mouth water .  thin , watery , overcarbonated .
the smell is intense and wonderful , very unique and really lends to the overall quality of this beer .  mouthfeel is like most others ... flat .
smells strongly of banana and bubblegum , with only a touch of clove . a candied note and a bit of white bread as well .  m - watery and sticky . its almost a thin beer .

the smell is pleasing . tons of sweet banana and light belgian candied sugars . a nice belgian yeast is present in the smell , with nice sweet lemon scents . a nice beer overall , but not as clean as i would have liked to see .  a bit bland for the style . body is a bit like soda water , and fades really fast .
nice nose of citrus and leather .  thin and tingly mouthfeel .
pours a hazy translucent straw color into a standard snifter . a thick fluffy white head tops this one off . tiny amounts of frothy lacing are left behind .  horrible macro version of the style .
a real nice sniffer .  the mouthfeel is light bodied and watery .

appearance : black like the back ground on this page smell : chocolate , coffee , malts and cookies taste : not as heavy as u think it would be taste like it smells butit is not a strong taste mouth : thin and creamy no carbanation drink : dont really like it that much i usualy only have one or two of these when i go out to eat .  the mouthfeel is light and watery , not much substance . a very watered down dunkel , i would skip this in the future .

this smells amazing ! t - the taste is good , not great ... yet .  finish really kills me as bad oaks comes off ... mouthfeel is the true downfall of this beer , watery light with no depth ... easy to drink but not good enough that i would .

s - very pronounced chocolate aromas , backed by roasted malts , some earthy , pine hops and a touch of coffee as it warms t - follows the nose , with the hop character very subtle , and the coffee barely making a presence as it warms .  a thin mouthfeel and not a lot of carbonation .

a : damn near perfect in my book . nicely hazy , radiant golden orange color . it 's got a big , soapy head that settles into a cap and leaves big sheets of lacing . so far so good .  mouthfeel is very flat and is not impressing at all .

750ml bottle poured into a tulip glass . appearance-brilliant ruby color with good clarity-absolutely gorgeous . moderate pale-pinkish head with decent retention .  the problem is that the beverage is thin and flat on the palate and leaves a really unpleasant metallic aftertaste .

i smell fresh cat piss , pine , grapefruit peel , fresh , fresh fresh hops ! ! ! ! still hard to live up to the smell . the mouthfeel is good and i have to say that if this beer was on tap i would stop for a pint or three every day .  m : flat . way too sweet for the ( non-existant ) level of carbonation .

very complex . thin to medium body with tastes of malted cereal , light residual sugar followed by roasted and hoppy bitterness . i am still amazed by the complexity of smells in this brew .  mouthfeel is way watery and i feel like it is slightly udnercarbonated .

well i poured this into a pint glass and it has a good head , a pink hue and good watermelon aroma . this is very easy to drink !  it does bring vanilla to mind . the sweetness almost removes it from the style of beer . far to thin for a brown ale .

a - clear honey colored with very little head . s - smells of ripe cherries , raspberries , honey , alcohol , mango , citrus , brandy , apple juice , flowers , and apricots . t - tastes of cherry , alcohol , brandy , citrus , candied sugar , sherry , and honey .  t : cheap carbonated corn . m : if it werent for the bottle this beer would have sunk years ago .

it 's sitting across the table but throwing great scents my way hazy amber orange with some sudsy head juicyfruit aromas : immense , zesty citrus , mint . not much pine , which is a nice change from the norm . good , robust , woody bitterness ( it really hangs on the tongue ) with excellent hop depth . mint .  not sourdough , but sour-smelling dough . taste is very flat and bland . malty and earthy , but with a dry finish .
smells great , best part of the beer for sure .  mouthfeel is overly carbonated .

the smell is strong of both a carmel brandy and a little alcohol is evident . the alcohol that was apparent in the scent is not in the mouthfeel , which is very nice .  mouthfeel is disappointing ; thin and watery , with too much carbonation for my taste .

really great smell on it . can definitely smell the hops coming out . lots of earthy , dirty , grittiness to it .  a - light , clear , yellow color with a thick head that dissipated quickly s - beer , cheap beer t - beer from a can , cheap beer from a can m - thin , flat , not much d - went down smooth , probably because i 'd wisely iced it down with some ice and rock salt so it would get really cold .
the nose on this evoked some memories of the amazing speedway stouts i had during sdbw with their vanilla and their toasted coconut variations .  the body was water and medium light .

smells absolutely wonderful ... pungent aroma of hops all the way ... piney , citrusy hops and i 'm loving it ... i want to smell this all night ... terrific blend of piney/grapefuit hops and sweet malts.. thought this was going to be a hop bomb all the way which would have been fine but i 'm surprised at the balance on this one .  m : bubbly and very thin .
smells delicious and this scent would be a great air freshener .  very thin mouthfeel , almost tasted flat , nothing special .

this is one of the best smelling beers i have ever had .  tasting it my first impression was how thin the body was for an english porter , compared to , for instance , the excellent fuller 's london porter or young 's double chocolate .

while really good , not as good as aroma . overall : really good . would have liked the flavor to measure up to the aroma but you still ca n't go wrong with this one .  mouthfeel : very carbonated with a thin , almost watery feeling .

a true imperial ipa , copious amount of pine and grapefruit . truly a beer geek 's beer ... my wife hated this beer . this is a well-made beer , and i certainly enjoy haivng one every now and then , but more a treat than a beer staple .  m - this bottle was flat . this gave the beer a thick and somewhat unenjoyable mouthfeel .

with the smell of opening a brand-new gar of rasberry jam . it has a powerful rasberry flavor that overpowers pretty much all the malt flavor .  slightly watery body with adequate carbonation . mouthfeel is slick and thin with a metallic and astringent finish as it dries .
the nose had a very fresh floral hop aroma .  it 's watery on the palate , surprisingly so - i 've had beers of 3 to 4 % alcohol that had more body . the finish is lightly astringent and bitter .
the aroma is a lovely `` double '' chocolate with lots of heavy roasted malts muted amongst the rich chocolate aroma .  zero carbonation .

smell- mmmmm , nice floral and citrus scents hit you right away . not too harsh , but about what you should expect out of an ipa . very tasty . mouthfeel- nice carbonation level .  the first thing i notice with this beer is the watery mouthfeel . the mouthfeel is terrible .
very nice . i was frightened from all the soy sauce talk , but the aroma really sucked me in and eased my fear .  the mouthfeel was very thin for a stout .

malt and hop scents are virtually non-existent . very aromatic . t : starts off with a quick dose of pumpkin flesh .  it has a difficult time making a favorable impression though since the body/mouthfeel is way too light for the style . what makes it to the taste buds is washed away in seconds as the anemic body collapses into nothingness . as a result , it 's hard to appreciate any depth or complexity in the beer at all .
s - smells strongly of pumpkin spice , and a little hoppy .  mouthfeel : thin and watery body , medium carbonation overall : highly overrated .

a - hazy amber , huge top , some lacing s - lemony citrus , honey , nice floral hops , very clean t & m - malt upfront with a unique flavor that i ca n't quite place .  mouthfeel is very thin with low carbonation , almost watery , drinkability is poor , huge bitterness and watery mouthfeel is a disappointment .

smell is very strong , like a clove-orange christmas pomander . really spicey and orange-peely , with coriander , grass and soap . if this thing tastes as good as it smells , i 'm gon na love it . the taste is dominated by the clove , soap and cookie-dough malt . it tastes good , but not as good or as complex as it smells . alcohol is notable from the warm burn in the aftertaste . all around , a very interesting beer .  the mouthfeel is pretty sad on this one . very watery and thin .

another great beer from denmark , this little country is no slouch in craft beer world.poured into an imperial nonic a near jet black except from some chocolate brown highlights when held to the light , a large blooming lighter mocha colored head atop.to me the aromas couldnt get any better , a fantastic display of chocolate and resiny hop , maybe the best aroma of any stout i have come across , if you like the hops no matter the style its spot on.the mouthfeel is a little sharp and not as full on as i would have liked.bitter chocolate , dark fruit , and a healthy dose of resiny hop make for a well rounded flavor profile , if that mouthfeel was just a little more smooth ! a really good beer that is close to being great , love the hop play going on .  feels really dry and grainy , very prickly in my mouth and sand papery , not impressed . there 's some interesting flavor components playing which eachother , but ultimately the mouthfeel and the harsh finish really let it down , shame that wo n't be reflected so well in the overall score with the way the weighting system works .
12 oz bottle into pilsner glass a : beautiful ! crystal clear yellow body topped off by one inch of white creamy foam .  however , extremely thin for a beer , and not very carbonated either .
smells fantastic ! fruity , citrus , & some serious hops . one of the better smelling beers i 've had .  mouthfeel is thin .

there is also a nice toffee and molasses sweetness to keep the aroma balanced . there are also hints of dark berries : to me it smelled like blueberry and raspberry . it is a very enticing aroma . taste : more roasted glory , and the first sip was a shock of burnt bitterness ; the overpowering intensity , though , passed after a couple sips .  it is a bit bland , the mouthfeel is way too watery .

an impressive nose . t : mouth puckering bitterness is the first thing i noticed . d , notes : this is very good . the type of beer that bas help move to the best of list .  mouthfeel is also watery with not much body and no carbonation but essentially pretty drinkable due to the fact that is just resembles colored water .
s : big fresh aromas of earthy grapefruit , and vanilla cookie dough . t : bit of a let down here .  the body is thin and watery ; one hardly notices the beer until it is gone .

very interesting beer . you can smell the hints of black & blue berries which is quite nice . it 's got a sharp taste of fruit , it reminds me almost of a fruity wine .  lack of carbonation , and this beer 's thin , watery mouthfeel combine to make a less-than-awesome drinking experience .

the aromas were delectable , with a balance between the banana and the spices ( clove & coriander ) with the banana just edging them out . they are all there , just much too subtlety .  mouthfeel is overyly fizzy and thin .
s : smells great ! coffee , chocolate , smells sweet .  m - no staying power .

i like the haziness of this one-but it is a bit more pale than most ipas i have come across . s-the nose is pretty great . piny hops are the main character with some grapefruit and other citrus coming through as well .  3.0 m too thin for my taste and my experience with better scottish ales ( like oskar blues ) .

aroma is a sweet malt-candy smell , bready , with a note of ginger and sourness . this beer tastes almost as good as it smells .  m - too thin , light body , fizzy carbonation . the mouthfeel on this beer is no good .

it had a great smoky aroma of smoked wood , smoked malts , olives , dark chocolate , roasted coffee beans , and just the slightest touch of caramel at the finish .  too much alcohol , comes of chemically ... the taste is slightly better than the aroma , but the mouthfeel is way over-carbonated and distracting and really detracts .
the smell is stunning . if i could bottle this and wear it , i would . just incredible . the taste is great , but does not live up tot he smell .  thin watery feel .

s : the best component of this beer , gratifying spices on top of a light roasted malt . d : good smell and its light make for easy drinking , but i would prefer more commanding flavors and spices .  `` simple '' is the best word i can use to describe the taste , but it does deliver with scorched malts with a touch of lactose . my biggest complaint with this beer is the mouthfeel- it 's way too watery .

s : nose is pleasantly funky , mild barnyard with notes of hay and grass .  caramel , coffee and cocoa are there , but overall balance is towards the dry and bitter mouthfeel - 2.0 lightly carbonated , bordering on flat and a little watery .
smell : absolutely delicious . the hops really fused well with the cedar in this case . love it . taste : it is a very sharp flavor .  mouthfeel was slightly thick and flat .

strikingly effervescent . s : even before i hold glass to my nose , i can smell whiffs of lactic sourness . yes , lactic acid is sharp . some vinegar , red wine vinaigrette , flowers , and a suggestion of brettanomyces . additional aromas includes oak/barrel and citric acid . i keep picking up a very light buttery note .  watery mouthfeel .

smells good too , obvious floral hops and substantial bready slightly sweet malt , both of which hit at the same time . this review is probably going to come out higher than it should due to the deceptively good appearance and smell .  the mouthfeel is very watered down like an american pale ale but i thought the pumpkin taste was enjoyable .

on-tap at bruery provisions a : the pour is just about black with a finger of dark brown head that displays impressive retention .  has a malty aroma , enticing , maybe some wheat too ? fizzy palate , mallty taste , fruity , not very lingering . thirst-quenching .

aromas are deliciously grapes , plums , candied sugars , and lots of fresh mild fruits .  this beer reminds me greatly of sol , corona , and modelo . i would n't be surprised if all mexican beer came from the same place ... dirty t-shirts squeezed out into a horse trough and then 'pasteurized ' by the horse before making its way into the bottle , but hey what do i know about cervezas .
it pours clear ruddy amber with a very thick and creamy tan head .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied and very watery .

cappuccino , freshly whipped cream , vanilla extract , milk chocolate powder give the nose a soft , enveloping appeal , cherry syrup , brown sugar , this noted it does have an unprocessed graininess to it which approximates hop bite , fills your nostrils and stays there for some time . in the mouth it 's medium-bodied with an acidic punch which jolts you and momentarily forestalls the arrival of the cappuccino , vanilla pudding , whipped cream , graham cracker pie crust , cinnamon powder , licorice and baker 's chocolate . there 's also more of a perfumed lift than downwards pressure on the palate . tart cherry pie wafts through the finish .  a : hazy dark yellow , very nice head , carb ok s : sweet , wet , doughy aroma t : hard to place this as a pale lager ; a pale something , yes ; tinny , rather hoppy for a lager , but not enough to do the tongue any favors ; mid-sweet m : flat , watery overall , not a terrible beer , but it is rather strange .

brett funkiness shows its face , but is n't as prominent as in others from similar varieties . like the smell , the brett funkiness is more subtle than others .  m : i was disappointed in the mouth feel . the light mouth feel really hurt for me .

anyhow , when you have a need for hops , this one certainly takes care of the fix . aroma , yes , just like it should be- huge citrus , flowers , grapefruit rind , oranges , probably lemons and limes if i was n't diving in so fast . this beer has a nice solid body holding in a creamy , milky nectar thats very smooth . the finish is bitter but smooth , maybe a little woody from all the hops . it only lacks a little malt complexity in the flavor , the malt seems a bit basic but does hold up well to the hop explosion .  the carbonation seems artificial , which really brings down the quality of this lager to something like a henry weinhards ( goes for a good taste , but it all seems somewhat fake ) . without the strong carbonation this would have been a common sight in my fridge , but as it is sieraa nevada summerfest will only make occassional appearences .
really delightful . very nice aroma sits about halfway between a brown ale and a porter .  the mouthfeel is way to under carbonated and watery for the style .

carbonating is correct level o : the aroma is great , but the taste is way over bittered with pine .  i feel like i have now experienced the true port/lost abbey experience , this is the first one i 've had that is flat ... a : pours dark brown with caramel highlights , zero head even after stiff pour , some clarity s : nose is predominantly oak and vanilla , some char quality in there , stout base takes a back seat t : vanilla and bourbon again dominate , some ashy character in there along with light notes of leather and tobacco , a bit of of boozieness on the finish mf : low carbonation is an understatement , medium body o : good flavors here , the lack of carbonation takes away from the quality a bit , for the premium price tag , i would expect carbonation .

a- nice burnt orange coloring with a decent head and great lacing s- unbelievable aromas ... the tropical fruits are just amazing . you could mistake this for a glass of juice . t- kind of a letdown from the smell , but really the smell set the bar ridiculously high . this is definitely one of the better iipas i 've had the pleasure of tasting .  mouthfeel : way too carbonated .

a : opaque , poured with small bubble head , thin veil of head , gives way over time to bubbles on side of glass but when glass is rotated there is still a ton of carbonation trapped in the beer s : full bourbon nose , malty , bourbon dominates , treacle , vanilla , intense t : full-flavored , extreme malt and bourbon flavor , not a great degree of heat , i love bourbon but it seems just a bit too much , toned down once beer warmed up m : warming , rounded , creamy , good body and mouthfeel without tons of etoh , strong bourbon aftertaste  head falls into the liquid way too quickly and seems to look more like bubble bath suds that the typical beautiful belgian head . certainly is the high point of the beer . alcohol comes a little too strong on the palate and seems to take over the other flavors . flat on the tonque . outrageously overpriced and overrated .

as soon as i opened the bottle , i was smacked with a heavy hoppy smell , easily reminded me it 's an ipa i 'm dealing with . s : an amazing combination of hops , pine , citrus , maybe some grape . t : interesting , with the token ipa hoppiness being the most notable aspect of it all . d : daunting at first , especially for me , not a huge fan of ipas , but i have to respect this beer . the dynamic flavor-smell combinations are remarkable , and though it 's not my favorite , the never-departing flavor may be the reminder that it is something to be reckoned with .  thin and watery for a dark beer . little carbonation . needless to say , i was disapointed in this beer .

two brothers heavy handed ipa : terrific aroma , very full and noticeable from several feet away . some heavy malt syrup aromas coupled with flowery hops make the aroma very appetizing . slick mouth feel .  mouthfeel : a bit on the fizzy side - really scrubs the tongue .

the aroma is fantastic , sweet , sour , chocolate malt all blending to a wonderful bouquet . taste is a bit too spicy , but otherwise very pleasantly complex . mouthfeel is dry and acrid , not as smooth as some others .  coppery colored amber with a sudsy froth top that subsides to a foam slick , no lacing , body is very thin and under-carbonated . perhaps as an effect of my bottle not being quite as fresh as it ought to be , i am detecting absolutely none of the fruity notes commonly perceived by other ba members ... .and this really hurts my overall impression quite a bit .

aroma is hugely redolent of skunky , sticky bud if you ask me . hugely hoppy , very fresh , quite similar to rubbing a fresh hop cone in your hands and sniffing . not unenjoyable , but very bitter , so much that i did n't really notice much else .  body is thin and flat .

s - the nose is vibrant and bursting with citrus hops . a little bit of malt and grass , but this is mostly all hops . rather than getting the fresh , juicy hops of the nose , they are overshadowed by a bitterness that just seems out of place . lots of potential here , especially in the nose , but unfortunately it just has a bit too much bitterness .  mouthfeel on both is not much , just clear water with a bit of beer bubbles .

the head is fluffy , off-white , and responsible , in part , for the best characteristic of this brew : the nose . the nose is a wonderful mix of allspice , nutmeg , and a bit of cinnamon , laid over a warm , inviting sweetness . it 's like sniffing a particularly delicious cookie . this brew goes down quite smoothly , and does not seem as high in alcohol as i thought it would .  the palate is thin .

this is very easily the best smelling beer i 've ever whiffed . taste is very disappointing . the smell is this brews strongest point , but it is also the source of the beer 's greatest flaw .  m : taste was below average for me , but the mouthfeel is even worse . super thin . light carbonation and no body make this almost watery .
smell : smells absolutely wonderful . bitter hops with a hint of sweetness .  limp bodied and watery , with no real aftertaste .
very pleasant . t - taste is much like the smell .  mouthfeel : very very thin .

in my opinion , racer 5 is one of the best smelling beers on the market . one whiff revels a cascade of piney and citrus hops aroma . it 's the quintessential west coast ipa aroma . for a beer topping out at 7.0 % , racer 5 is ridiculously drinkable .  carbonation appears low . beer is thin and boring , not much there at all . mild sweetness very water like . bummer .

top of the line nose on this one , just fantastic . my first impression was damn ! the consensus was this was an excellent beer , & there was a marked difference once it warmed - a collection of `` yeah , it 's ok '' changed to `` damn , this is good '' after 10-15 minutes . really glad i got to try this one , thanks again tucker !  the taste is similar , just a little sweeter , with more wateriness and less hops . i could n't get over how watery this beer tasted and felt . maybe i 'm rating it a little low because of that , but it has a lot of strikes against it : watery , bland , and definitely not a bargain .

dipas aroma 's are awesomely hard to describe .  has a bit of a sweet maltiness and maple flavor does come out more as it warms m : very thin feel for a porter and leaves an odd buttery coating d : nothing really appauling , and nothing overpowering so it is drinkable , but i probably wo n't get another
